CVE-2006-0005.title: Microsoft Windows Media Player Plugin EMBED element buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0005.body: Windows Media Player Plugin is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious HTML document containing a specially-crafted EMBED element, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on a victim's system with privileges of the victim. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious HTML document on a Web site and persuading the victim to visit the site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your systen, as listed in the Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-006. See References.

CVE-2006-0006.title: Microsoft Windows Media Player BMP image parsing service buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0006.body: Microsoft Windows Media Player is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds in the BMP image parsing service. By creating a malicious bitmap file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on a victim's system with privileges of the victim, once the victim opens the malicious file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the file on a Web site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-0008.title: Microsoft Windows and Office Korean IME privilege elevation
CVE-2006-0008.body: Microsoft Windows and Office with the Korean Input Method Editor (IME) installed could allow an attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system. In some cases, the Korean IME exposes functionality that runs with LocalSystem privileges. An attacker with valid authentication credentials on the affected system could exploit this vulnerability to gain complete control of the affected system.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-009. See References.

CVE-2006-0010.title: Microsoft Windows embedded Open Type Web font buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0010.body: Microsoft Windows could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a heap-based buffer overflow in T2EMBED.DLL when handling specially-crafted embedded Open Type fonts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by embedding Open Type fonts on a malicious Web page, and persuading a potential victim to visit the page, or sending a malicious HTML email containing embedded Open Type fonts to a potential victim. Once the victim visits the Web page or views the email, the attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code to gain complete control of the victim's system.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-0021.title: Microsoft Windows IGMP v3 denial of service
CVE-2006-0021.body: Microsoft Windows XP and Windows Server 2003 are vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by improper handling of Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) packets. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specially-crafted IGMP v3 packets to an affected system to cause the system to reboot.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-0023.title: Microsoft Windows XP "Authenticated Users" insecure default permissions
CVE-2006-0023.body: A design error regarding default permissions in Microsoft Windows XP and Windows Server 2003 could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges. Members of the "Authenticated Users" group are granted permissions to modify Simple Service Discovery Protocol (SSDP) and Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) service configurations. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and execute arbitrary programs with elevated privileges. Note: This vulnerability also affects multiple Avaya and Nortel Networks devices and software, which utilize Microsoft Windows Server 2003.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-011. See References.

CVE-2006-0025.title: Microsoft Windows Media Player PNG buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0025.body: Microsoft Windows Media Player is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of PNG files. By creating specially-crafted PNG image file and hosting it on a Web site or sending it to a potential victim as an email attachment, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, once the file is opened.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-0031.title: Microsoft Excel record buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0031.body: Microsoft Excel is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. A remote attacker could create a malicious Excel file that uses a malformed record and host it on a Web site or send it to a potential victim as an email attachment. When the file is opened, the attacker could overflow a buffer and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the victim.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-0032.title: Microsoft Indexing Service cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0032.body: Microsoft Windows Web servers with the Microsoft Indexing Service enabled are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper query validation. On systems that have an anonymous Web-based query interface enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted message to inject malicious script into a dynamic Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to spoof Web content, obtain sensitive information or perform actions on the Web site as the victim. Note: This vulnerability could also be exploited by an authentication local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system by sending a specially-crafted packet to the Indexing Service.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-0034.title: MSDTC NdrAllocate() invalid memory access denial of service
CVE-2006-0034.body: The Microsoft Distributed Transaction Service Coordinator (MSDTC) installed on Microsoft Windows is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a buffer overflow in the MSDTC NdrAllocate() function. By sending a specially-crafted network message to the system, a remote attacker could cause the MSDTC service to stop responding.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-018. See References.

CVE-2006-0035.title: Linux kernel af_netlink.c denial of service
CVE-2006-0035.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by a vulnerability in af_netlink.c. A local attacker could set the nlmsg_len field to 0 to cause an infinite loop in the netlink_rcv_skb() function, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux Kernel (2.6.15.1 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.

CVE-2006-0038.title: Linux kernel netfilter do_replace integer overflow
CVE-2006-0038.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to an integer overflow in the Netfilter do_replace() function. A local attacker with CAP_NET_ADMIN rights could exploit this vulnerability to cause a buffer overflow in the copy_from_user() function and possibly execute arbitrary commands on the system with elevated privileges.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux kernel (2.6.16 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1097-1 and DSA-1103-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4:Refer to RHSA-2006:0575-22 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Turbolinux:Refer to Red Hat Linux Security Advisory TLSA-2007-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0047.title: Freeciv packets.c denial of service
CVE-2006-0047.body: Freeciv is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a vulnerability in packets.c. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the server to crash by sending specially-crafted packets with negative compressed size values.Upgrade to the latest version of Freeciv (2.0.8 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA 994-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-03-11 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-0053.title: Imager JPEG and TGA file denial of service
CVE-2006-0053.body: Imager could allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service. This is caused by a segmentation fault that can occur when writing a 2 or 4 channel JPEG image or a 2 channel TGA image. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a Perl application that uses an affected version of the Imager module to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Imager (0.50 or later), available from the Imager Web page. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1028-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0101.title: sBLOG index.php and search.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0101.body: sBLOG is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php and search.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'p' or keyword parameters to execute script in a victim’s Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim’s cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of sBLOG (version 0.7.3 Beta or later), available from the sBlog Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0103.title: TinyPHPForum users directory information disclosure
CVE-2006-0103.body: TinyPHPForum could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The users directory is stored inside the Web root directory by default. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information, such as the encrypted usernames and passwords of registered users.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0140.title: NavBoard post.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0140.body: NavBoard is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the post.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by embedding malicious script in a Navboard forum post, which would be executed in a victim’s Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0143.title: Microsoft Windows GRE ExtCreateRegion() and ExtEscape() WMF denial of service
CVE-2006-0143.body: Multiple versions of Microsoft Windows are vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by improper handling of WMF images containing improper ExtCreateRegion() or ExtEscape() function calls. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted WMF image to cause the application using the Windows Graphics Rendering Engine (GRE) to crash.Install Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer (910620), available from Microsoft's Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0144.title: go-pear.php PEAR PHP proxy redirection
CVE-2006-0144.body: The go-pear.php script, when located inside the Web root directory, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a malicious proxy server to the go-pear.php script, which would redirect the server to an attacker-controlled server from which to install PEAR packages. Note: The go-pear.php script is installed by default with the Apache2Triad package.Upgrade to the latest version of Apache2Triad (1.4.4 or later), available from the Apache2Triad Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0146.title: ADOdb server.php SQL command execution
CVE-2006-0146.body: ADOdb is a database connectivity library for PHP. Multiple PHP-based applications using versions of ADOdb prior to 4.70 could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the server. If the MySQL root password is empty and the server.php script is located within the Web root, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the server.php script using the "sql" parameter to execute arbitrary SQL commands. This vulnerability affects the following PHP-based applications: Mantis, PostNuke, Moodle, and Cacti.Upgrade to the latest version of ADOdb (4.70-for-php or later), available from SourceForge.net. Se References.For Cacti:Upgrade to the latest version of Cacti (0.8.6.h or later), available from the Cacti Web site. See References.For Moodle:Upgrade to the latest version of Moodle (1.5.3+ or later), available from the Moodle Web site. See References.For PostNuke:Upgrade to the latest version of PostNuke (0.761a or later), available from the PostNuke Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1029-1, DSA-1030-1, and DSA-1031-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-07 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0159.title: Domus escribir.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-0159.body: Domus is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the escribir.php script using the email parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0160.title: Venom Board add_post.php3 SQL injection
CVE-2006-0160.body: Venom Board is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the add_post.php3 script using the parent, root or topic_id variables, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0175.title: Web Wiz Forums search_form.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0175.body: Web Wiz Forums is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search_forum.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using search parameters to execute script in a victim’s Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim’s cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the current version of WebWiz products (version 7.01 or later) available from the Web Wiz Forums Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0179.title: Cisco IP Phone SYN flood denial of service
CVE-2006-0179.body: The Cisco IP Phones 7940 and 7960 are vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker could flood any port on affected device with SYN packets to cause the device to reboot, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest firmware version (7.1(1) or later), as listed in the Cisco Security Notice dated 2006 January 13 2130 UTC (GMT). See References.

CVE-2006-0192.title: ASPSurvey Login_Validate.asp and login.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-0192.body: ASPSurvey is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the Login_Validate.asp or login.asp script using the password parameter, which could allow the attacker to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access to the admin console.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0199.title: Mini-NUKE Extension news.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-0199.body: Mini-NUKE Extension is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the news.asp script using the hid parameter which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0203.title: Mini-NUKE membership.asp unauthorized password modification
CVE-2006-0203.body: Mini-NUKE Extension could allow a remote attacker to modify a known user's password. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP POST request to the membership.asp script to change a known user's password and gain unauthorized access to the victim's Mini-NUKE account.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0205.title: Wordcircle v_login.php SQL injection security bypass
CVE-2006-0205.body: Wordcircle is vulnerable to SQL injection in the v_login.php script, which could be used to gain unauthorized administrative access to the application. If the magic_quotes_gpc setting is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the v_login.php script using the password field, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0205.title: Wordcircle multiple scripts SQL injection
CVE-2006-0205.body: Wordcircle is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to various scripts using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0207.title: PHP ext/session and header function HTTP response splitting
CVE-2006-0207.body: PHP is vulnerable to an HTTP response splitting attack, caused by improper validation of the session id that is returned in the Set-Cookie HTTP response header. If a remote attacker sends an HTTP GET containing a specially-crafted session id to a Web server that is configured to use PHP session extension, the attacker could inject arbitrary HTTP headers into the HTTP response body. An attacker could use this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, session hijacking, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activity.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (5.1.2 or later), available from The PHP Group Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0276-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (php):Refer to RHSA-2006:0501-6 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-03-22 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-261-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian/GNU Linux (php4):Refer to DSA-1331-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-0223.title: 123 Flash Chat Server "user" field directory traversal
CVE-2006-0223.body: 123 Flash Chat Server could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the Web server. A remote attacker could supply a specially-crafted 'user' parameter on the new user registration page, which could be used to create arbitrary files outside of the Web root directory.Upgrade to the latest version of 123 Flash Chat Server (5.1_2 or later), available from the 123 Flash Chat Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0233.title: microBlog functions.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0233.body: microBlog is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the functions.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the BBcode URL tag to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of microBlog (2.1 or later), available from the microBlog Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0236.title: Mozilla Thunderbird attachment extension spoofing
CVE-2006-0236.body: Mozilla Thunderbird could allow a remote attacker to spoof email file attachments and trick user's into saving or opening malicious files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating an attachment with a specially-crafted file name and a "Content-Type" header that does not match the file extension, which would cause the actual file type to be hidden from the victim.Upgrade to the latest version of Thunderbird (1.5 or later), available from the Mozilla Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0240.title: SimpleBlog month parameter SQL injection
CVE-2006-0240.body: SimpleBlog is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using the month parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0249.title: geoBlog viewcat.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-0249.body: BitDamaged (formerly geoBlog) is vulnerable to SQL injection. If the magic_quotes_gpc setting is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the viewcat.php script using the tmpCategory variable, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database and possibly obtain the administrator's login name and password hash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0269.title: Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006
CVE-2006-0269.body: The Oracle Critical Patch Update dated January 2006 is not installed, which could allow an attacker to exploit multiple vulnerabilities. Refer to the risk matrix from the Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for details.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0270.title: Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006
CVE-2006-0270.body: The Oracle Critical Patch Update dated January 2006 is not installed, which could allow an attacker to exploit multiple vulnerabilities. Refer to the risk matrix from the Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for details.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0270.title: Oracle TDE masterkey in plaintext in SJA
CVE-2006-0270.body: Oracle 10g stores the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) masterkey in plaintext in the Oracle System Global Area (SJA). A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the masterkey used for TDE encryption.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0298.title: Multiple Mozilla products XML parser denial of service
CVE-2006-0298.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird and SeaMonkey, are vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by an error in the XML parser. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted XML document to cause the application to crash and possibly obtain sensitive information.For Firefox:Upgrade to the latest version of Firefox (1.5.0.1 or later), as listed in Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-02. See References.For SeaMonkey:Upgrade to the latest version of SeaMonkey (1.0 or later), as listed in Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-02. See References.

CVE-2006-0301.title: Xpdf splash/splash.cc buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0301.body: Xpdf is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the splash/splash.cc file, which is used to process splash images. By creating a malicious PDF file containing a specially-crafted splash image, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the Xpdf process. Exploitation of this vulnerability would require the attacker to deliver the malicious PDF file to a potential victim, either by hosting the file on a Web site or sending it to the victim as an email attachment, and then the victim would have to open the file using Xpdf or an application linked to Xpdf.For KDE kpdf:Refer to KDE Security Advisory 20060202-1 for patch or upgrade information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-974-1 and DSA-971-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (xpdf):Refer to RHSA-2006:0201-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (kdegraphics):Refer to RHSA-2006:0206-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (GPdf):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-02-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (KPdf):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-02-05 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Xpdf and Poppler):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-02-04 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-249-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-0308.title: htmltonuke module for PHP-Nuke htmltonuke.php file include
CVE-2006-0308.body: The htmltonuke module for PHP-Nuke could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the htmltonuke.php script using the filnavn parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0318.title: BlogPHP index.php or config.php SQL injection security bypass
CVE-2006-0318.body: BlogPHP is vulnerable to SQL injection. If the magic_quotes_gpc setting is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php or config.php scripts using the username or password parameters, which could allow the attacker to bypass security and add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of January 2006.

CVE-2006-0321.title: Fetchmail bounced message denial of service
CVE-2006-0321.body: Fetchmail is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by the use of an invalid pointer when attempting to free memory after a message is bounced to the original sender or to the postmaster. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause Fetchmail to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Fetchmail (6.3.2 or later), as listed in Fetchmail Security Announcement fetchmail-SA-2006-01. See References.For Apple Mac OS X:Apply Apple Security Update 2006-004, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-0325.title: Etomite Content Management System todo.inc.php default backdoor
CVE-2006-0325.body: Etomite Content Management System could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, due to a default backdoor in the manager/includes/todo.inc.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL to the tod.inc.php script that uses the cij parameter to pass malicious code to the popen() function, allowing the attacker to execute commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest beta release of Etomite (0.6.1 RTM or later), available from the Etomite Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0332.title: Ecartis pantomime security bypass file uploading
CVE-2006-0332.body: Ecartis (formerly Listar) could allow a remote attacker to bypass security, if the pantomim functionality is enabled. Email attachments are saved to the pantomime directory, which is in the Web root directory, when sent to the [listname]-request@[hostname] addresses. If the pantomime feature is enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to place arbitrary malicious files on the server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0340.title: Cisco IOS SGBP UDP packet denial of service
CVE-2006-0340.body: Multiple Cisco devices running Cisco Internetwork Operating System Software (IOS) with the Stack Group Bidding Protocol (SGBP) enabled, are vulnerable to a denial of service attack. If a remote attacker sends a specially-crafted UDP packet to port 9900 on an affected device, the attacker could cause the device to stop responding until the system watchdog timer initiates a reset of the device.Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-20060118-sgbp for upgrade or workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0342.title: Rockliffe MailSite HTTP Mail management agent wconsole.dll denial of service
CVE-2006-0342.body: Rockliffe MailSite is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted parameters in a URL request to wconsole.dll to cause the HTTP Mail management agent service to crash.Apply the Hotfix for this vulnerability, available from the Rockliffe FTP site. See References.

CVE-2006-0353.title: LSH file descriptor leak information disclosure and denial of service
CVE-2006-0353.body: LSH leaks file descriptors of the random generator seed file to user shells that are started by lshd. This could allow a local attacker to cause a denial of service by truncating the seed file, or obtain sensitive information that could be used to crack session keys.For vendor-supplied patch, refer to the lsh-bugs Mailing List posting dated Fri Jan 20 17:44:07 CET 2006. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-956-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0354.title: Cisco Aironet ARP table memory exhaustion denial of service
CVE-2006-0354.body: Cisco Aironet Wireless Access Points running Cisco IOS are vulnerable to a denial of service attack. If a remote attacker sends spoofed Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) messages to the management interface of an affected device, the attacker could consume all available memory resources causing a denial of service. The device must be rebooted in order to resume normal functionality.Refer to Cisco Security Advisory cisco-sa-20060112-wireless for upgrade and workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0359.title: CounterPath eyeBeam SIP header buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0359.body: CounterPath eyeBeam Softphone is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of SIP header values. By sending an INVITE request containing an overly long SIP header value, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the victim's system.Upgrade to the latest version of eyeBeam (1.1 build 3014 or later), available from the CounterPath Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0362.title: 3Com TippingPoint IPS HTTP traffic denial of service
CVE-2006-0362.body: TippingPoint IPS is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using malformed HTTP traffic to cause the device to utilize a large amount of CPU resources.Upgrade to the latest version of TippingPoint OS (TOS), available from the TippingPoint Threat Management Center. See References.

CVE-2006-0364.title: MyBB HTML Signature cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0364.body: MyBB (formerly MyBulletinBoard) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input passed to the user Signature field. If the 'Allow HTML in Signatures' setting is enabled (which is not the default setting), a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of MyBB (1.1.1 or later), available from the MyBB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0374.title: ACT P202S VoIP phone multiple undocumented default ports and services
CVE-2006-0374.body: ACT (Advantage Century Telecommunication Corporation) P202S could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the device using one of several undocumented open ports. TCP port 7, TCP port 512, and UDP port 17185 are open by default and provides access to the echo, rlogin, and VxWorks WDB remote debug service (wdbrpc). In addition, the device has a hard coded NTP service that is enabled by default. An attacker could connect to one of these ports or use the NTP service to view or modify device configuration information, reset the device to the factory default settings, write to the registry, dump memory, and perform other malicious activity.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0388.title: Apple Mac OS X Safari HTTP redirect
CVE-2006-0388.body: Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server could allow a remote attacker to access arbitrary resources caused by a vulnerability in Safari. A remote attacker could exploit a vulnerability in Safari that allows HTTP redirection to a local file.Apply Security Update 2006-001, available from the Apple Security Update 2006-001. See References.

CVE-2006-0397.title: Apple Mac OS X open safe files after downloading command execution
CVE-2006-0397.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary shell commands on the system, caused by improper validation of file types by the Safari, LaunchServices, and CoreTypes components. This vulnerability would allow an attacker to trick a user into opening a malicious shell script that would appear to be a file type that is safe for opening. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page or by sending a malicious HTML email attachment. Note: This is a variation of the vulnerability described in US-CERT Vulnerability Note VU#999708.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.As a workaround, disable the "Open safe files after downloading" option in Safari Web browser.

CVE-2006-0398.title: Apple Mac OS X open safe files after downloading command execution
CVE-2006-0398.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary shell commands on the system, caused by improper validation of file types by the Safari, LaunchServices, and CoreTypes components. This vulnerability would allow an attacker to trick a user into opening a malicious shell script that would appear to be a file type that is safe for opening. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page or by sending a malicious HTML email attachment. Note: This is a variation of the vulnerability described in US-CERT Vulnerability Note VU#999708.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.As a workaround, disable the "Open safe files after downloading" option in Safari Web browser.

CVE-2006-0399.title: Apple Mac OS X open safe files after downloading command execution
CVE-2006-0399.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary shell commands on the system, caused by improper validation of file types by the Safari, LaunchServices, and CoreTypes components. This vulnerability would allow an attacker to trick a user into opening a malicious shell script that would appear to be a file type that is safe for opening. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page or by sending a malicious HTML email attachment. Note: This is a variation of the vulnerability described in US-CERT Vulnerability Note VU#999708.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.As a workaround, disable the "Open safe files after downloading" option in Safari Web browser.

CVE-2006-0403.title: e-moBLOG index.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-0403.body: e-moBLOG is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the $monthly or $login parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0412.title: CyberShop user login SQL injection
CVE-2006-0412.body: CyberShop is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the user login script which could allow the attacker to bypass security and add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0413.title: NewsPHP index.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-0413.body: NewsPHP is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the discuss, tim, id, last, or limit parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0416.title: SleeperChat multiple .php scripts txt parameter security bypass
CVE-2006-0416.body: SleeperChat is could allow a remote attacker to bypass security. A remote attacker could post a message anonymously via the chat_no.php or the chat_if.php scripts using the 'txt' parameter without being prompted to supply a username.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0434.title: phpXplorer sShare directory traversal
CVE-2006-0434.body: phpXplorer could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the workspaces.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the sShare parameter to view arbitrary files outside of the Web root on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0454.title: Linux kernel icmp.c ip_options_echo() denial of service
CVE-2006-0454.body: Linux kernel versions 2.6.12 through 2.6.15.2 are vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by improper handling of ICMP responses when the ip_iptions_echo() function in icmp.c fails. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted ICMP packet to cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux Kernel (2.6.15.3 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-250-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-0459.title: Flex lexicographical scanner class buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0459.body: Fast Lexical Analyzer (Flex) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in a particular class of lexicographical scanners. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Flex (2.5.33 or later), available from the Flex Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1020-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-03-07 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-260-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-0481.title: libpng png_set_strip_alpha() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0481.body: libpng is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the png_set_strip_alpha() function. By sending a PNG image containing alpha channels, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of libpng (1.0.18, 1.2.8 or later), available from the libpng Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0205-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0510.title: Daffodil CRM userlogin.jsp SQL injection
CVE-2006-0510.body: Daffodil CRM is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the userlogin.jsp function using the userLoginBox or passwordBox parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0525.title: Multiple Adobe products insecure default file and folder permissions
CVE-2006-0525.body: Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe Photoshop, and Adobe Illustrator create several files and folders with insecure permissions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by replacing affected files and folders with malicious applications that would be executed with the privileges of any subsequent user who runs the affected application, allowing the attacker to perform malicious activity on the system with elevated privileges.Refer to Adobe Security Advisory APSB06-01 for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-0527.title: HP Tru64 DNS BIND unauthorized access
CVE-2006-0527.body: HP Tru64 UNIX when configured as a DNS BIND name server could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized privileged access to the system.Refer to Hewlett-Packard Company Security Bulletin HPSBTU02095 for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-0533.title: cPanel multiple scripts allow cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0533.body: cPanel is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0553.title: PostgreSQL SET ROLE command privilege elevation
CVE-2006-0553.body: PostgreSQL could allow an authenticated database user to gain elevated privileges. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted SET ROLE command to other database users after an error has occurred to gain the privileges of the targeted user.Upgrade to the latest version of PostgreSQL (8.1.3 or later), available from the PostgreSQL Web site. See references.For OpenPKG:Refer to OpenPKG Security Advisory OpenPKG-SA-2006.004 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0565.title: Loudblog loudblog/inc/backend_settings.php file include
CVE-2006-0565.body: Loudblog could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the loudblog/inc/backend_settings.php script using the path parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Loudblog (0.42 or later), available from the Loudblog Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0586.title: Oracle Database SYS.KUPV$FT_INT multiple functions SQL injection
CVE-2006-0586.body: Oracle 10g is vulnerable to multiple SQL injection attacks in the SYS.KUPV$FT_INT package. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the UPDATE_JOB, ACTIVE_JOB, ATTACH_POSSIBLE, ATTACH_TO_JOB, CREATE_NEW_JOB, DELETE_JOB, DELETE_MASTER_TABLE, DETACH_JOB, GET_JOB_INFO, GET_JOB_QUEUES, GET_SOLE_JOBNAME, MASTER_TBL_LOCK, or VALID_HANDLE function using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0586.title: Oracle Database SYS.KUPV$FT multiple functions SQL injection
CVE-2006-0586.body: Oracle 10g is vulnerable to multiple SQL injection attacks in the SYS.KUPV$FT package. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the ATTACH_JOB, OPEN_JOB, or HAS_PRIVS function using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - January 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0591.title: Openwall crypt_blowfish insecure salt generation weak password hashes
CVE-2006-0591.body: crypt_blowfish from Openwall create salts for extended-DES-based and MD5-based password hashes insecurely. An attacker could try candidate passwords against a stolen password file (obtained from a different vulnerability) at a slightly higher rate. Through private correspondence, the vendor states this vulnerability is neither local nor remote, as this vulnerability can only be exploited in combination with another vulnerability or exposure.Upgrade to the latest version of crypt_blowfish (1.0 or later), available from the crypt_blowfish Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Postgresql):Refer to RHSA-2006:0526-8 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0619.title: QNX Neutrino RTOS libAP ApFindTranslationFile() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0619.body: QNX Neutrino RTOS is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the libAP library, caused by improper bounds checking by the ApFindTranslationFile() function. By supplying an overly long ABLPATH environment variable, a local attacker could overflow and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges. Note: An attacker could also exploit this vulnerability using the ABLANG environment variable.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0619.title: QNX Neutrino RTOS libph setitem() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0619.body: QNX Neutrino RTOS is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the libph library, caused by improper bounds checking by the setitem() function. By supplying an overly long PHOTON_PATH environment variable, a local attacker could overflow and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0663.title: IBM Lotus Domino Web Access attachment file name cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0663.body: Lotus Domino Web Access is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of the email attachment names. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by embedding malicious JavaScript within an email attachment name, which would allow the attacker to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the victim's session, once the victim opens the malicious email.Upgrade to the latest version of Domino Web Access (6.5.5 or later) or (7.0.1 or later), available from the IBM Software Support Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0663.title: IBM Lotus Domino Web Access javascript: URL cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0663.body: Lotus Domino Web Access is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of javascript: URLs. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by inserting "&#13" in a malicious javascript: URL, which would allow the attacker to bypass security restrictions and execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the victim's session.Upgrade to the latest version of Domino Web Access (6.5.5 or later) or (7.0.1 or later), available from the IBM Software Support Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0663.title: IBM Lotus Domino Web Access .html attachment cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0663.body: Lotus Domino Web Access is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of attached .html files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by embedding malicious JavaScript within an .html email attachment, which would allow the attacker to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the victim's session, once the victim opens the malicious attachment.Upgrade to the latest version of Domino Web Access (6.5.5 or later) or (7.0.1 or later), available from the IBM Software Support Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0692.title: PHP/MYSQL Timesheet index.php and changehrs.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-0692.body: PHP/MYSQL Timesheet is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php or changehrs.php script using the $yr, $month, $day or $job parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0700.title: imageVue readfolder.php information disclosure
CVE-2006-0700.body: imageVue is could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the readfolder.php script using invalid 'path' or 'ext' parameters to view directory listings.Upgrade to the latest version of imageVue (16.2 or later), available from the imageVue Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0706.title: Gastebuch homepage cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0706.body: Gastebuch is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input entered into the Homepage URL field. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the current version of Gästebuch (version 1.3.3 or later) available from the Gästebuch Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0707.title: PyBlosxom PATH_INFO information disclosure
CVE-2006-0707.body: PyBlosxom could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request containing multiple forward slash (/) characters in the PATH_INFO variable, allowing the attacker to view arbitrary files on the Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of PyBlosxom (1.3.2 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.

CVE-2006-0710.title: Isode M-Vault LDAP double free memory corruption denial of service
CVE-2006-0710.body: Isode M-Vault is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a double free memory corruption error. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted LDAP request to cause a denial of service on affected systems. This vulnerability was discovered with the ProtoVer LDAP testsuite version 1.1. Note: It may also be possible for this vulnerability to be exploited to execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Isode M-Vault (11.3v1 or later), available from the Isode M-Vault Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0723.title: Magic News Lite preview.php file include
CVE-2006-0723.body: Magic News Lite could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the preview.php script using the $php_script_path parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0725.title: Plume CMS /manager/frontinc/prepend.php file include
CVE-2006-0725.body: Plume CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the /manager/frontinc/prepend.php script using the '_PX_config[manager_path]' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Plume CMS (1.0.4 or later), available from the Plume CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0725.title: Plume CMS prepend.php file include
CVE-2006-0725.body: Plume CMS could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the prepend.php script using the '_PX_config[manager_path]' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote or local system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Plume CMS (1.0.4 or later), available from the Plume CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0730.title: Dovecot APPEND command denial of service
CVE-2006-0730.body: Dovecot is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted APPEND command to cause the server to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Dovecot (1.0 beta 3 or later), available from the Dovecot Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0734.title: Half-Life server SV_CheckForDuplicateNames denial of service
CVE-2006-0734.body: The Half-Life server is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the SV_CheckForDuplicateNames function. An authenticated remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by connecting multiple players with empty names to crash the server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0744.title: Linux kernel uncanonical return address denial of service
CVE-2006-0744.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of uncanonical return addresses on Intel EM64T CPUs. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause an exception to be reported in the SYSRET, which would result in the kernel exception handler running on the user stack with the wrong GS, leading to a denial of service condition.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.9 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4:Refer to RHSA-2006:0493-6 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 3:Refer to RHSA-2006:0437-22 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1103-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:028 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:047 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-0748.title: Multiple Mozilla products table tag handling code execution
CVE-2006-0748.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system, caused by improper handling of invalid and specially-crafted table-related tags which could result in a negative array index. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a potential victim to visit a malicious Web page or open a malicious HTML email attachment.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-27 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-0749.title: Multiple Mozilla products nsHTMLContentSink.cpp memory corruption
CVE-2006-0749.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a vulnerability in nsHTMLContentSink.cpp related to the parsing of HTML tags that appear in a specific order. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory on the system and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the system to crash.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-18 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-0750.title: Invision Power Board Army System allows cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0750.body: Army System is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the army.php script using the userstat parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0772.title: Hitachi Business Logic - Container extended receiving box function SQL injection
CVE-2006-0772.body: Hitachi Business Logic - Container is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the extended receiving box function, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the appropriate fixed software version for your system, as listed in Hitachi Support Software Vulnerability Information HS06-002. See References.

CVE-2006-0772.title: Hitachi Business Logic - Container input form SQL injection
CVE-2006-0772.body: Hitachi Business Logic - Container (BLC) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL commands to an input form which could allow the attacker to add, modify or delete data in the back-end database.Upgrade to the appropriate fixed software version for your system, as listed in Hitachi Support Software Vulnerability Information HS05-025. See References.

CVE-2006-0779.title: XMB Forum u2u.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0779.body: Extreme Message Board (XMB) Forum is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of GPC data by the u2u.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability when composing messages in the forum to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of XMB Forum (1.9.8 or later), available from the XMB Forum Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0795.title: Quirex convert.cgi information disclosure
CVE-2006-0795.body: Quirex could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a vulnerability in the convert.cgi script. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the convert.cgi script using the $quiz_head, $quiz_foot, or $template variables to read arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0800.title: PostNuke user.php and NS-Languages cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0800.body: PostNuke is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the user.php and the NS-Languages module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'htmltext' or 'language' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of PostNuke (0.762 or later), available from the PostNuke Download Web page. See References.

CVE-2006-0807.title: NJStar .njx font name buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0807.body: NJStar Chinese Word Processor and NJStar Japanese Word Processor are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of font names. By creating a malicious .njx document file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, once the malicious .njx file is opened. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious .njx file on a Web site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Upgrade to the latest version of NJStar Chinese or Japanese Word Processor (5.10 or later), available from the NJStar Software Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0813.title: WinAce ARJ header buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0813.body: WinAce is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of large ARJ headers. By sending an ARJ archive with an overly large header block, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system when the malicious archive is opened.Upgrade to the latest version of WinACE (2.61 or later), when it becomes available from the WinACE Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0842.title: @Mail HTML image tag cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0842.body: @Mail WebMail System is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an email message containing script embedded within HTML IMG tags to execute code in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0854.title: iUser Ecommerce common.php $include_patch file include
CVE-2006-0854.body: iUser Ecommerce could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the common.php script using $include_path variable to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of iUser Ecommerce (2.2 or later), available from the iUser Ecommerce Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0855.title: zoo misc.c fullpath() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-0855.body: zoo is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the fullpath() function in misc.c file. By creating a specially-crafted archive containing an overly long filename or pathname, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system once the archive is opened by the target victim.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-991-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to GLSA 200603-05 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Summary Report SUSE-SR:2006:005 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-0857.title: e107 Chatbox cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0857.body: e107 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user supplied input by the Chatbox plugin. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0859.title: Guestbox action.php HTTP POST authentication bypass
CVE-2006-0859.body: Guestbox could allow a remote attacker to gain administrative access to the application. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP POST request to the action.php script to bypass authentication and post comments as the 'administrator'.Upgrade to the latest version of Guestbox (0.8 or later), available from the Guestbox Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0860.title: Guestbox gbshow.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0860.body: Guestbox is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the gbshow.php script. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the homepage field to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Guestbox (0.8 or later), available from the Guestbox Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0883.title: OpenSSH OpenPAM denial of service
CVE-2006-0883.body: OpenSSH is vulnerable to a denial of service. If OpenSSH is running with OpenPAM and the OpenSSH-forked child process terminates during PAM authentication, the PAM child process could continue to run. After a number of child processes are running, OpenSSH would stop accepting connections, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSH (3.8.1p1 or later), available from the OpenSSH FTP Download Web page. See References.

CVE-2006-0884.title: Multiple Mozilla products in-line mail forwarding JavaScript code execution
CVE-2006-0884.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to execute malicious JavaScript on a victim's system. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability if a victim uses the default HTML "rich mail" editor when forwarding in-line mail to execute JavaScript in the victim's mail client with privileges of the victim, allowing the attacker to perform malicious actions on the victim's system or use their email client to send spam.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-21 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-0887.title: PHPLIB unspecified system compromise
CVE-2006-0887.body: The PHP Base Library (PHPLIB) could allow a remote attacker to gain complete control over an affected system.Upgrade to the latest version of PHPLIB (7.4a or later), available from the PHPLIB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0896.title: Simple Machines Forum (SMF) Sources/Register.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0896.body: Simple Machines Forum (SMF) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Sources/Register.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'X-Forwarded-For' header to execute script in an administrator's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Simple Machines Forum (1.0.7 or later), available from the Simple Machines Forum Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0911.title: IPSwitch WhatsUp Professional NmService.exe denial of service
CVE-2006-0911.body: IPSwitch WhatsUp Professional 2006 is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the login.asp script to cause the nMService.exe service to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0914.title: Bugzilla duplicates.cgi SQL injection
CVE-2006-0914.body: Bugzilla is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the duplicates.cgi script using the mostfreqthreshold parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Bugzilla (2.18.5 or 2.20.1 or later), available from the Bugzilla Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0938.title: eZ Publish ReferrerURL cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0938.body: eZ publish is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input passed to the ReferrerURL parameter. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0945.title: Archangel Weblog index.php file include
CVE-2006-0945.body: Archangel Weblog could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the "index" parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0950.title: unalz archive directory traversal
CVE-2006-0950.body: unalz could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted .alz archive, which would allow the attacker to traverse directories and overwrite arbitrary files on a victim's system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to download and extract the malicious archive.Upgrade to the latest version of unalz (0.55 or later), available from the unalz Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0959.title: MyBB misc.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-0959.body: MyBB (formerly MyBulletinBoard) is vulnerable to SQL injection. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the misc.php script using the comma parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of MyBB (1.10 or later), available from the MyBB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-0961.title: Cilem Haber unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2006-0961.body: Cilem Haber is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to unspecified scripts using unspecified parameters, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0966.title: NCP Network Communication Secure Client ncprwsnt.exe denial of service
CVE-2006-0966.body: NCP Network Communication Secure Client is vulnerable to a denial of service. A local user could send a request to ncprwsnt.exe containing a large number of arguments to cause the system to consume all available resources.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0967.title: NCP Network Communication Secure Client UDP denial of service
CVE-2006-0967.body: NCP Network Communication Secure Client is vulnerable to a denial of service. A local attacker could send arbitrary UDP datagrams to ports 0 to 65000 to cause the system to consume all available resources.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0976.title: SPiD scan_lang_insert.php file include
CVE-2006-0976.body: SPiD could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary local files. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the scan_lang_insert.php script using the Lang parameter to specify a file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to view arbitrary files on the system or execute arbitrary commands on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-0996.title: PHP phpinfo() long array cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-0996.body: PHP is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the php_print_gpcse_array() function. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability on affected PHP-based Web applications using an array value larger than 4096 bytes to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (5.1.3 or later), available from The PHP Group Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0276-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (php):Refer to RHSA-2006:0501-6 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-08 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:024 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1006.title: Sendcard unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2006-1006.body: Sendcard is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to unspecified scripts, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the current version of Sendcard (version 3.3.0 or later) available from the Sendcard Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1018.title: Dawaween poems.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1018.body: Dawaween is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to poems.php script using the id parameter in a diwan view action, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1039.title: SAP Web Application Server HTTP response injection information disclosure
CVE-2006-1039.body: SAP Web Application Server could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting arbitrary bytes into an HTTP response, allowing the attacker to obtain authentication and possibly other sensitive information. A remote attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.Upgrade to the latest kernel patch for SAP, available from the SAP Web site. See SAP Note 908147 and 915084.

CVE-2006-1043.title: Microsoft Visual Studio and Visual InterDev .dbp and .sln DataProject buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1043.body: Microsoft Visual Studio and Microsoft Visual InterDev are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of the DataProject field in Visual Studio Database Project File (.dbp) and Visual Studio Solution (.sln) files. By creating a malicious .dbp or .sln file with an overly long DataProject field, an attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on a victim's system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open and compile the malicious project file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1056.title: Multiple kernel AMD K7/K8 CPUs floating-point unit information disclosure
CVE-2006-1056.body: Linux and BSD kernels running on systems with AMD K7 or K8 CPUs could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error where FOP, FIP and FDP x87 registers are only saved or restored by FXSAVE or FXRSTOR if the exception summary bit is set to 1. This error could result in processes that use floating-point unit (FPU) operations to leak sensitive information, which could be used by an attacker to launch further attacks against the affected system.For Linux kernel:Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.9 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For VMware 2.5.3:Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in the VMware Advisory esx-253-200610-patch. See References.For FreeBSD:Refer to FreeBSD Security Advisory FreeBSD-SA-06:14.fpu for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1097-1 and DSA-1103-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 2.1:Refer to RHSA-2006:0579-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 3:Refer to RHSA-2006:0437-22 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4:Refer to RHSA-2006:0575-22 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For ESX Server 3.0.0:Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in VMware Advisory Doc ID: 2533126. See References.For VMware ESX Server 2.1.3:Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in the VMware Advisory esx-213-200610-patch. See References.For VMware ESX Server 2.5.4:Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in the VMware Advisory esx-254-200610-patch. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:028 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.
