CVE-2006-1060.title: xzgv and zgv JPEG image parsing buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1060.body: xzgv is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow caused by improper bounds checking of JPEG images. By creating a specially-crafted JPEG image, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, if a victim views the image within the CMYK/YCCK color space.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the xzgv Web page. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Summary Report SUSE-SR:2006:008 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1038-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-10 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-1079.title: thttpd command line buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1079.body: thttpd is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of user supplied input in a command line argument. By sending a specially-crafted command line argument containing shell metacharacters, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1095.title: Apache mod_python FileSession command execution
CVE-2006-1095.body: Mod_python could allow a remote attacker with valid authentication credentials to execute arbitrary commands on the server, caused by improper validation of session IDs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted cookie to execute arbitrary commands on the system with privileges of the Web server process.Upgrade to the latest version of Mod_python (3.2.8 or later), available from the Mod_python Web page. See References.

CVE-2006-1119.title: cPanel fantastico path disclosure
CVE-2006-1119.body: cPanel could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a vulnerability in the fantastico module. A remote authenticated attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. This information could be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1148.title: Peercast procConnectArgs function buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1148.body: Peercast is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of the user supplied input by the procConnectArgs function in servmgr.cpp. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP GET request with an overly long parameter, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Peercast (0.1217 or later), available from the Peercast Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-03-17 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1154.title: Fantastic News CONFIG[script_path] file include
CVE-2006-1154.body: Fantastic News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the archive.php or headlines.php file using the CONFIG[script_path] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Fantastic News (2.1.5 or later), available from the Fantastic News Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1154.title: Fantastic News archive.php and headlines.php file include
CVE-2006-1154.body: Fantastic News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the archive.php or headlines.php script using the CONFIG[script_path] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Fantastic News (2.1.5 or later), available from the Fantastic News Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1173.title: Sendmail nested multipart MIME message denial of service
CVE-2006-1173.body: Multiple products that utilize the Sendmail MTA (Mail Transfer Agent) are vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of deeply nested multipart MIME messages. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malformed MIME message to consume large amounts of system resources or cause the mail queue process to abort.Upgrade to the latest version of Sendmail (8.13.7 or later), available from the Sendmail Web site. See References.For Sendmail Switch, Intelligent Quarantine, Sendmail Advanced Message Store (SAMS), Sendmail Sentrion, Mailstream Gatekeeper, Mailstream Governor and Sendmail Pro:Refer to Sendmail, Inc. Security Advisory Sendmail-SA-200605-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0515-10 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.F-Secure Messaging Security Gateway, X200, P600 and P800:Refer to F-Secure Security Bulletin FSC-2006-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For OpenBSD:Refer to OpenBSD 3.9 release errata for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1155-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:032 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-1174.title: Shadow-utils useradd insecure file permission
CVE-2006-1174.body: Shadow-utils could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. The installation useradd.c utility creates the user's mail spool file with insecure permissions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read or modify the user's mailbox.Upgrade to the latest version of Shadow-utils (4.0.8 or later), available from the Shadow-utils Web site. See References.For VMware ESX 3.0.1:Apply Patch Bundle ESX-1001692, available from the VMware Web site. See References.For VMware ESX 3.0.0:Apply Patch Bundle ESX-1001207, available from the VMware Web site. See References.For VMware ESX 3.0.2:Apply Patch Bundle ESX-1001726, available from the VMware Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-02 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Avaya (shadow-utils):Refer to ASA-2007-249 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1189.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Double-Byte Character Set code execution
CVE-2006-1189.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a vulnerability regarding the handling of URLs that contain Double-Byte Character Sets (DBCS). A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted URL containing Double-Byte Character Sets and persuading a potential victim to click the malicious URL. The attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code and possibly gain complete control over the victim's system.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1192.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer address bar spoofing
CVE-2006-1192.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to display spoofed content in a browser window after the user has navigated away from the attacker's Web site. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof a legitimate Web site with a malicious page.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1193.title: Microsoft Exchange Outlook Web Access cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1193.body: Microsoft Exchange is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by Outlook Web Access (OWA). A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted email containing malicious script embedded within the email body. If the victim opens the email using Outlook Web Access, the script would be executed in the victim's Web browser within the security context of victim's Outlook Web session.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1228.title: Drupal login session hijacking
CVE-2006-1228.body: Drupal could allow a remote attacker to hijack a user's session caused by a vulnerability during login. A remote attacker could use a specially-crafted link, that once followed by the victim, would allow the attacker to hijack the session once the victim logs into Drupal.Upgrade to the latest version of Drupal (4.5.8 or 4.6.6, or later), available from the Drupal Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1007-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1230.title: Belchior Foundry vCard create.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1230.body: Belchior Foundry's vCard is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the create.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the card_id, uploaded, card_fontsize, or card_color parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1249.title: Apple QuickTime FlashPix image integer overflow
CVE-2006-1249.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to an integer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed FlashPix (FPX) image files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted FPX file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1251.title: Sa-exim greylistclean.cron file deletion
CVE-2006-1251.body: Sa-exim could allow a remote attacker to delete arbitrary files caused by a vulnerability in greylistclean.cron. A remote attacker could send an email containing a specially-crafted address that could be used to delete files on the system, once the email is processed by the greylistclean.cron job.Upgrade to the latest version of Sa-exim (4.2.1 or later), available from the Sa-exim Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1275.title: GGZ Gaming Zone XML denial of service
CVE-2006-1275.body: GGZ Gaming Zone is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of malformed XML data. A remote attacker could join with a nickname within single quotes, a nickname over 16 characters, or a long text message to cause the client to be disconnected from the server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1278.title: @1 File Store PRO download.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1278.body: @1 File Store PRO is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the download.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1278.title: @1 File Store multiple scripts SQL injection
CVE-2006-1278.body: @1 File Store is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the password.php script using the 'email' parameter or to multiple other scripts using the 'id' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of @1 File Store (2.0 or later), available from the UPOINT:: CGI Script Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1303.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffect1Input ActiveX object code execution
CVE-2006-1303.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a vulnerability regarding the handling of COM objects as ActiveX Controls. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page containing an invalid DXImageTransform.Microsoft.MMSpecialEffect1Input ActiveX object, and persuading a potential victim to visit the page. The attacker could use this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code and possibly gain complete control over the victim's system.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1308.title: Microsoft Office Excel FNGROUPCOUNT buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1308.body: Microsoft Office is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious Excel file containing a malicious FNGROUPCOUNT value , a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the user, once the Excel file is opened. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1316.title: Microsoft Office string parsing buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1316.body: Microsoft Office is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious Office file containing a specially-crafted string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the user, once the Office file is opened and the string is parsed using an affected Office application. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site. Note: This is different than the vulnerabilities described in CVE-2006-1540 and CVE-2006-1316.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1330.title: phpWebSite friend.php and article.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1330.body: phpWebSite is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the friend.php or article.php scripts using the 'sid' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of phpWebSite (0.9.0 or later), available from the phpWebSite Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1337.title: MailEnable POP authentication
CVE-2006-1337.body: MailEnable Standard Edition has an unspecified vulnerability related to the handling of POP authentication.For MailEnable Standard Edition:Upgrade to the latest version of MailEnable Standard Edition (1.93 or later), available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.For MailEnable Professional Edition:Upgrade to the latest version of MailEnable Professional Edition (1.73 or later), available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.For MailEnable Enterprise Edition:Upgrade to the latest version of MailEnable Enterprise Edition (1.21 or later), available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1338.title: MailEnable webmail component denial of service
CVE-2006-1338.body: MailEnable Standard Edition is vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by a vulnerability in the webmail component. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause 100% CPU utilization, resulting in a denial of service.For MailEnable Standard Edition:Upgrade to the latest version of MailEnable Standard Edition (1.93 or later), available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.For MailEnable Professional Edition:Upgrade to the latest version of MailEnable Professional Edition (1.73 or later), available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.For MailEnable Enterprise Edition:Upgrade to the latest version of MailEnable Enterprise Edition (1.21 or later), available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1360.title: MusicBox multiple SQL injection
CVE-2006-1360.body: MusicBox is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the 'start' or 'show' parameter or to the action function using the 'page' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1367.title: Motorola PEBL U6 and V600 name spoofing
CVE-2006-1367.body: Motorola PEBL U6 and Motorola cellular phones could allow a remote attacker to spoof the device name, caused by improper handling of incoming connections to the Headset Audio Gateway. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request containing new line characters from a Bluetooth device on channel 3 to spoof the device name that is displayed in the security dialogs and possibly convince the victim to accept an incoming connection. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 4, 2010.

CVE-2006-1371.title: XHP CMS FileManager PHP file upload
CVE-2006-1371.body: XHP CMS could allow a remote attacker to upload and execute malicious PHP files. XHP CMS fails to restrict access to the FileManager upload scripts. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to upload malicious PHP files and then execute arbitrary code on the system by specifying the uploaded file in a specially-crafted URL request to the suntzu.php script.Upgrade to the latest version of XHP CMS (0.5.1 or later), available from the XHP CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1380.title: Trend Micro InterScan Messaging Security Suite (IMSS) ISNTSmtp insecure directory permissions
CVE-2006-1380.body: Trend Micro InterScan Messaging Security Suite (IMSS) could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges. The ISNTSmtp directory is created with insecure permissions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by replacing .exe files within the directory with Trojans, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges when the system is restarted or when another user logs on.Upgrade to the latest versions of InterScan Messaging Security Suite (5.7.0.11121 or later), available from the InterScan Messaging Security Suite Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1417.title: Web Quiz Pro prequiz.asp and student.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1417.body: Web Quiz Pro is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the prequiz.asp and student.asp scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the exam or msg parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1439.title: Apple Mac OS X AppKit NSSecureTextField weak security
CVE-2006-1439.body: Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server could provide weaker than expected security caused by a vulnerability in NSSecureTextField used by the AppKit module. When switching between text input fields, sensitive information and keyboard events could be disclosed to other applications in the same window. This could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-003, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1453.title: Apple QuickTime PICT font buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1453.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed PICT image files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted PICT file containing malformed font information to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1454.title: Apple QuickTime PICT image buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1454.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed PICT image files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted PICT file containing malformed image data to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1458.title: Apple QuickTime JPEG integer overflow
CVE-2006-1458.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to an integer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed JPEG images. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted JPEG image to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1459.title: Apple QuickTime movie file integer overflow
CVE-2006-1459.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to an integer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed QuickTime movie files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted movie file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1460.title: Apple QuickTime movie file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1460.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed QuickTime movie files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted movie file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1461.title: Apple QuickTime Flash movie buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1461.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed Flash movie files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted Flash movie file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1462.title: Apple QuickTime H.264 integer overflow
CVE-2006-1462.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to an integer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed H.264 movie files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted H.264 movie file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1467.title: Apple iTunes AAC file integer overflow
CVE-2006-1467.body: Apple iTunes is vulnerable to an integer overflow, caused by improper parsing of Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) files, which could lead to memory corruption. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a potential victim to open a malicious .M4A or .M4P file containing a specially-crafted 'sample_size_table' value.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple iTunes (6.0.5 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1469.title: Apple Mac OS X ImageIO TIFF image buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1469.body: Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of TIFF image files by ImageIO. By creating a malformed TIFF file and sending it to a potential victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the affected application to crash, once the file is opened.Apply the Mac OS X 10.4.7 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1470.title: Apple Mac OS X OpenLDAP Open Directory denial of service
CVE-2006-1470.body: Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server could allow a remote attacker to launch a denial of service attack against the Open Directory server. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted LDAP request to cause the Open Directory server to crash.Apply the Mac OS X 10.4.7 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1491.title: Horde Application Framework help viewer command execution
CVE-2006-1491.body: Horde Application Framework could allow a remote attacker to execute commands on the system, caused by improper validation of unspecified variables by the help viewer. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system with privileges of the Web server process.Upgrade to the latest version of Horde Application Framework (3.1.1 or 3.0.10) or apply the patches available from the Horde Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (horde3):Refer to DSA-1033-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (horde2):Refer to DSA-1034-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-02 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1500.title: Tilde CMS index.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1500.body: Tilde CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1501.title: OneOrZero Helpdesk index.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1501.body: OneOrZero Helpdesk is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of OneOrZero Helpdesk (1.6.5.3 or later), available from the OneOrZero Helpdesk Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1503.title: Virtual War multiple scripts vwar_root parameter file include
CVE-2006-1503.body: Virtual War (VWar) could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the vwar_root parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Virtual War (1.5.0 R12 or later), available from the vwar.biz Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1513.title: abc2ps ABC file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1513.body: abc2ps is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows. By creating a malicious ABC file, an attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on a victim's system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the file.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1041-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-1522.title: Linux kernel _keyring_search_one() denial of service
CVE-2006-1522.body: Linux kernel could allow a local attacker to cause a denial of service when adding a new key, caused by a vulnerability in the _keyring_search_one() function. An attacker could send a specially-crafted keyctl request to cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.3 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0493-6 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1524.title: Linux kernel madvise_remove security bypass
CVE-2006-1524.body: Linux kernel could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of shared memory mm/madvise.c file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the madvise_remove command to gain write access to read-only attachments and shared memory.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.9 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1097-1 and DSA-1103-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:028 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1525.title: Linux kernel ip_route_input() denial of service
CVE-2006-1525.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL dereference that can occur in the ip_route_input() function. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the system to crash by requesting a route for a multicast IP address.Upgrade to the latest stable version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.9 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0493-6 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1097-1 and DSA-1103-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:028 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1528.title: Linux kernel SG driver denial of service
CVE-2006-1528.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an unspecified vulnerability in the SG driver (drivers/scsi/sg.c) when handling dio transfers to memory mapped IO spaces. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a kernel panic and a denial of service condition for valid users.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (version 2.4.33.1 or later), available from the Linux Kernel Web site. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to Ubuntu Security Advisory USN-302-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0493 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:042 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:047 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Advisorie MDKSA-2006:123 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1183-1 or DSA-1184-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-1540.title: Microsoft Office property field buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1540.body: Microsoft Office is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious Office file containing a specially-crafted property field, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the user, once the malicious file is opened. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1540.title: Microsoft Office string parsing buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1540.body: Microsoft Office is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious Office file containing a specially-crafted string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the user, once the Office file is opened and the string is parsed using an affected Office application. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site. Note: This is different than the vulnerabilities described in CVE-2006-1540 and CVE-2006-1316.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1549.title: PHP deep recursion denial of service
CVE-2006-1549.body: PHP is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in deep recursion handling. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted request containing a deep array structure to cause the PHP platform and PHP application to crash.For Debian GNU/Linux (phpmyadmin):Refer to DSA-1370-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1550.title: Dia XFig XFig Import Plugin buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1550.body: Dia XFig is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the XFig import plugin. By sending a specially-crafted XFig file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Dia XFig (0.95-pre6 or later), available from the Dia XFig Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1025-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0280-8 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-14 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-266-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1552.title: Apple Mac OS X ImageIO JPEG buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1552.body: Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of JPEG image files. By sending a specially-crafted image with malformed JPEG metadata, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-003, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1593.title: ZDaemon multiple function invalid memory access denial of service
CVE-2006-1593.body: ZDaemon is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by memory access errors in the ZD_MissingPlayer, ZD_UseItem, ZD_LoadNewClient, and ZD_ValidClient functions. A remote attacker could connect to the game server using an invalid MAXPLAYERS or NUMARTIFACTS value to cause the server to crash. Note: This vulnerability also affects X-Doom, which is a server only ZDaemon port.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1610.title: SQuery Gaming Server Module "libpath" file include
CVE-2006-1610.body: SQuery Gaming Server Module could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the 'libpath' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system. Note: This vulnerability also affects multiple vendor's game server related software that utilize the SQuery module, including Autonomous LAN Party (ALP).Upgrade to the latest version of SQuery, available to registered users from the SQuery Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1626.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer .swf address bar spoofing
CVE-2006-1626.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to spoof the address bar, caused by an error when loading a Macromedia Flash file (.swf). A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted Web page, which would load a .swf file and a Web site in the same window using the 'window.open' method, which could allow the remote attacker to spoof the address bar of the browser. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to conduct spoofing or phishing attacks. Note: This vulnerability may also affect other Web browsers, including Firefox.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-1652.title: UltraVNC VNCLog::ReallyPrint() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1652.body: Ultr@VNC (UltraVNC) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of the VNCLog::ReallyPrint() function when logging information. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the VNC service to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of UltraVNC (1.0.2 or later), available from the UltraVNC Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1652.title: Ultr@VNC error buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1652.body: Ultr@VNC (UltraVNC) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of the Log::ReallyPrint() function when logging replies received from a VNC server during login. By sending an overly long string in an error response, a remote attacker in control of the VNC server could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system. Note: An administrative user must have changed the default "Log debug infos to the WinVNC.log file" setting in the configuration for this vulnerability to exist. However, if the setting is changed back to the default settings, this vulnerability will still be exploitable.Upgrade to the latest version of Ultr@VNC (1.0.2 or later), available from the Ultr@VNC Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1676.title: MAXdev MD-Pro index.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1676.body: MaxDev MD-Pro is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the 'topicid' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of MAXdev, available from the MD-Pro Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1677.title: MAXdev MD-Pro legacy.php path disclosure
CVE-2006-1677.body: MaxDev MD-Pro could allow a remote attacker to determine the installation path for MD-Pro. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL to the includes/legacy.php script to cause MD-Pro to return an error that displays the full installation path. A remote attacker could use this information to launch additional attacks on MD-Pro.Upgrade to the latest version of MAXdev MD-Pro (1.0.81 or later), available from the MAXdev MD-Pro Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1721.title: Cyrus SASL DIGEST-MD5 denial of service
CVE-2006-1721.body: Carnegie Mellon University's Cyrus-SASL library is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an undisclosed vulnerability during DIGEST-MD5 negotiation.Upgrade to the latest version of Cyrus-SASL (2.1.21 or later), available from the Carnegie Mellon University's FTP site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1042-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server:Apply Apple Security Update 2006-006 or Mac OS X 10.4.8 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:025 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-1725.title: Multiple Mozilla products translucent XUL content window spoofing
CVE-2006-1725.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to spoof certain windows in a Web browser, caused by a condition that can occur when XUL content windows interact with the browser history mechanism. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious Web site to cause certain windows to become translucent, which could be used to trick a victim into executing arbitrary code.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-29 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1726.title: Multiple Mozilla products js_ValueToFunctionObject() security bypass
CVE-2006-1726.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions in js_ValueToFunctionObject(), caused by an unspecified vulnerability related to the setTimeout() and ForEach functions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious Web site to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-28 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1729.title: Multiple Mozilla products text box input control unauthorized file access
CVE-2006-1729.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to read arbitrary files from a victim's system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using a text box as a file upload control or modifying the input control in an event handler on a malicious Web site to read any known file on a victim's system, if the attacker could persuade a potential victim to visit the site.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-23 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1730.title: Multiple Mozilla products CSS letter-spacing element integer overflow
CVE-2006-1730.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, are vulnerable to an integer overflow caused by improper handling of the CSS letter-spacing element. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious Web page to cause a heap-based buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the victim's system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit the malicious page.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-22 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-1731.title: Multiple Mozilla products valueOf.call() and valueOf.apply() cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1731.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by calling the valueOf.call() or valueOf.apply() function without an argument to bypass same-origin policy restrictions and execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-19 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1733.title: Multiple Mozilla products XBL binding valueOf.call and valueOf.apply code execution
CVE-2006-1733.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper access restrictions on built-in privileged XBL bindings. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the valueOf.call() or valueOf.apply() method or an XBL binding inserted into the DOM's document.body prototype chain in a malicious Web site to execute arbitrary JavaScript on a victim's system with the privileges of the targeted XBL binding.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-16 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1735.title: Multiple Mozilla products XBL eval method code execution
CVE-2006-1735.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of JavaScript functions created using an eval in a XBL method binding. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious Web site to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-14 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. CVE-2006-1737.title: Multiple Mozilla products JavaScript regular expression memory corruption
CVE-2006-1737.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper handling of overly long regular expressions by the JavaScript engine. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory on the system and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the system to crash.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-11 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.,/P>For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1739.title: Multiple Mozilla products CSS border-rendering memory corruption
CVE-2006-1739.body: Multiple Mozilla products, including Firefox, Thunderbird, Mozilla Suite and SeaMonkey, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) border-rendering code. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory on the system and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the system to crash.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-11 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:022 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1746.title: PHPlist index.php file include
CVE-2006-1746.body: PHPlist could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary local files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the lists/index.php script containing "dot dot" sequences in the $database_module or $language_module variable to traverse directories and include arbitrary local files. It is also possible for a remote attacker to embed malicious code in the log files, which could be combined with the file include vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of PHPlist (2.10.4 or later), available from the PHPlist Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1749.title: phpListPro config file include
CVE-2006-1749.body: phpListPro could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. If register_globals is activated, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the config.php script using the returnpath parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote or local system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Refer to the phpListPro Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-1750.title: Autogallery index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1750.body: Autogallery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'pic' or 'show' parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1751.title: MvBlog multiple SQL injection
CVE-2006-1751.body: MvBlog is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to multiple scripts which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the current version of MvBlog (1.6 or later) available from the SourceForge.net Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1760.title: JetPhoto Server name and page cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1760.body: JetPhoto Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the name or page parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1781.title: Monster Top List sources/functions.php file include
CVE-2006-1781.body: Monster Top List could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the sources/functions.php script using the root_path parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the web server.Refer to the Monster Top List Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-1790.title: Multiple Mozilla products InstallTrigger.install() memory corruption
CVE-2006-1790.body: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper handling of a specially-crafted InstallTrigger.install() method. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the system to crash. Note: This vulnerability is caused by a regression fix in Mozilla Firefox 1.0.7.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-11 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1046-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1044-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1051-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Mozilla):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-04-18 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-271-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris 10:Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Sun Alert ID: 102550. See References.MFor SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-1826.title: Snipe Gallery view.php and image.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1826.body: Snipe Gallery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the view.php or image.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'gallery_id' or 'image_id' parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1834.title: Opera wcsncpy() CSS attribute buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1834.body: Opera is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of user-supplied input that is passed to the wcsncpy() function. By creating a malicious Web page containing an overly long CSS attribute, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause a victim's browser to crash and possibly execute arbitrary code on the victim's system, if the victim could be persuaded to visit the attacker's Web site.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (8.54 or later), available from the Opera Software Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-01 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1857.title: Linux kernel SCTP HB-ACK handling denial of service
CVE-2006-1857.body: The Linux kernel Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) module could allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service, caused by a buffer overflow vulnerability when handling HB-ACK chunks. By sending a specially-crafted HB-ACK packet, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.18 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1097-1 and DSA-1103-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4:Refer to RHSA-2006:0575-22 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:047 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-1861.title: freetype2 read_lwfn() integer overflow
CVE-2006-1861.body: freetype2 is vulnerable to an integer overflow in the read_lwfn() function. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted LWFN file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system.Upgrade to the latest version of freetype2 (2.2.1 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1095-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-02 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0500-10 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For OpenPKG:Refer to OpenPKG Security Advisory OpenPKG-SA-2006-017 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102705 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-1865.title: Beagle indexing command execution
CVE-2006-1865.body: Beagle could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands caused by insecure indexing. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a helper application to execute arbitrary commands on the system with the privileges of the user.Upgrade to the latest version of Beagle (0.2.5 or later), available from the Beagle Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1868.title: Oracle Database SYS.DBMS_SNAPSHOT_UTL buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1868.body: Oracle Database is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the SYS.DBMS_SNAPSHOT_UTL package (Advanced Replication component). A remote attacker with PUBLIC permissions could exploit this vulnerability using the VERIFY_LOG procedure to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - April 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1871.title: Oracle Database SYS.DBMS_LOGMNR_SESSION SQL injection
CVE-2006-1871.body: Oracle Database is vulnerable to SQL injection in the SYS.DBMS_LOGMNR_SESSION package (Log Miner component). A remote attacker with EXECUTE_CATALOG_ROLE permissions could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the DELETE_FROM_TABLE procedure, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to Oracle Critical Patch Update - April 2006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1888.title: phpGraphy index.php authentication bypass
CVE-2006-1888.body: phpGraphy could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access to a system. By sending a direct request to the index.php script using the editwelcome parameter with a fixed value, a remote attacker could bypass the authentication process and gain unauthorized access to the system with administrative privileges. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to possibly launch further attacks on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of phpGraphy (0.9.12 or later) available from the phpGraphy Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1890.title: myEvent event.php and initialize.php file include
CVE-2006-1890.body: myEvent could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the event.php or the initialize.php scripts using the 'myevent_path' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of myEvent (1.4 or later), available from the myEvent Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1896.title: phpBB Admin code execution
CVE-2006-1896.body: phpBB could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code caused by improper filtering in the Admin panel. A local attacker with access to the admin panel could modify the font and signature fields to execute arbitrary PHP code on the system.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1066-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1898.title: TinyPHPForum profile.php or error.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-1898.body: TinyPHPForum is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the profile.php script using the 'uname' parameter or by the error.php script using the login fields. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-1957.title: Mambo and Joomla! rss.php denial of service
CVE-2006-1957.body: Mambo and Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the rss.php script. An attacker could send multiple URL requests to the rss.php script containing invalid 'feed' parameters to cause the consumption of all available disk space, resulting in a denial of service.For Joomla!:Upgrade to the latest version of Joomla! (1.0.8 or later), available from the Joomla! Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1962.title: PCPIN Chat main.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-1962.body: PCPIN Chat is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the main.php script using the login parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of PCPIN Chat (5.0.5 or later), available from the PCPIN Chat Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1983.title: Apple Mac OS X PredictorVSetField() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1983.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the PredictorVSetField() function. By creating a malicious TIFF file and persuading a victim to open the file using either Safari, Preview, Finder or QuickTime, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the affected application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious file on a Web site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Upgrade to the latest updade for Apple Mac OS X Safari (2006-003 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1983.title: Apple Mac OS X CFAllocatorAllocate() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1983.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the CFAllocatorAllocate() function. By creating a malicious GIF file and persuading a victim to open the file using either Safari or the Preview application, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the affected application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious file on a Web site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Upgrade to the latest updade for Apple Mac OS X Safari (2006-003 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-1985.title: Apple Mac OS X BOMArchiveHelper buffer overflow
CVE-2006-1985.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the BOMArchiveHelper application, which is the default file archive application in Mac OS X. By creating a malicious ZIP archive, and then persuading a victim to open the malicious archive, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer in the BOMStackPop() function and cause the application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious archive on a Web site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Apply the available update as listed in the Apple Security Update 2006-003. See References.

CVE-2006-1991.body: PHP is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an input validation error in the substr_compare() function. If a remote attacker passes an overly large 'length' argument to the substr_compare() function via a PHP script that calls the zend_binary_strcmp() and zend_binary_strcasecmp() functions, the attacker could cause a memory access violation error to occur, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (5.1.3 or later), available from The PHP Group Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-08 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-1992.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer nested OBJECT tag memory corruption
CVE-2006-1992.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on a victim's system, caused by memory corruption error that can occur when handling a Web page with nested HTML OBJECT tags. By creating a malicious Web page containing specially-crafted OBJECT tags, a remote attacker could cause Internet Explorer to crash or possibly execute arbitrary commands on a victim's system, once the malicious page is opened.Refer to the Microsoft Web site for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information (KB916281). See References.

CVE-2006-1993.title: Mozilla Firefox contentWindow.focus() designMode code execution
CVE-2006-1993.body: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption vulnerability that can occur when "designMode" is set to "on". A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code or cause a victim's browser to crash by creating a malicious Web page that uses the contentWindows.focus() JavaScript control to reference a deleted object.Upgrade to the latest version of Firefox (1.5.0.3 or later), as listed in Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-30. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1053-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1055-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP Tru64 UNIX:Refer to Hewlett-Packard Company Security Bulletin HPSBTU02118 SSRT061145 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-2016.title: phpLDAPadmin template_engine.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2016.body: phpLDAPadmin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the /template_engine.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the Container DN, Machine Name or UID Number field to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-2016.title: phpLDAPadmin scope or dn parameters cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2016.body: phpLDAPadmin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search.php script using the scope parameter or by multiple other scripts using the dn parameter. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 4, 2010.

CVE-2006-2026.title: LibTIFF tif_jpeg.c double-free memory corruption
CVE-2006-2026.body: LibTIFF could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused my a double-free memory corruption vulnerability in tif_jpeg.c. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a malicious TIFF image, which would cause an application that uses the LibTIFF library to crash or allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, once the image is viewed.Upgrade to the latest version of LibTIFF (3.8.2 or later), available from the LibTIFF Web page. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0425-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1054-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-17 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-2069.title: PowerDNS EDNSO packet recursor denial of service
CVE-2006-2069.body: PowerDNS is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker could send a malformed EDNSO packet to an affected server to cause the recursor to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of PowerDNS (3.0.1 or later), available from the PowerDNS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2084.title: FarsiNews index.php and admin.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2084.body: FarsiNews is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php and admin.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'month' or 'mod' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2085.title: SpeedProject multiple products ACE buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2085.body: SpeedProject SpeedCommander is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the CxAce60.dll and CxAce60u.dll libraries. By creating a malicious ACE archive file with a specially-crafted file name, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, once the malicious ACE file is extracted.Upgrade to the latest version of Squeez (5.20 Build 4600 or later), SpeedCommander (10.53 Build 4590 or later) or SpeedCommander (11.10 Build 4590 or later), available from the SpeedProject Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2090.title: MySmartBB misc.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-2090.body: MySmartBB is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the misc.php script using the id or username parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2093.title: Nessus NASL split() denial of service
CVE-2006-2093.body: Nessus is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a vulnerability in the Nessus Attack Scripting Language (NASL) split() function. A local attacker with permissions to execute NASL scripts could exploit this vulnerability by loading a malicious plugin in nessusd to cause the consumption of all available CPU and memory resources, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Nessus (2.2.8 / 3.0.3 or later), available from the Nessus Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2095.title: Phex request denial of service
CVE-2006-2095.body: Phex is a file sharing application running on the Gnutella Network. Phex versions prior to 2.8.6 are vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could send multiple chat requests to a victim and log off causing Phex to consume a large amount of resources.Upgrade to the latest version of Phex (2.8.6 or later), available from the Phex Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2108.title: OCE 3121/3122 Web management interface long URL denial of service
CVE-2006-2108.body: OCE printers are vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the Web management interface to cause the printer to stop responding.
