The printer must be restarted to regain normal functionality.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2111.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer mhtml: URL redirection information disclosure
CVE-2006-2111.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information, caused by improper handling of URL redirects that use the mhtml: URI. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page, and persuading a potential victim to visit the page, or by sending it to a potential victim as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS07-034. See References.

CVE-2006-2157.title: Plogger gallery.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-2157.body: Plogger is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the gallery.php script using the 'ID' parameter, which could allow the attacker to gain administrator rights and possibly add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2178.title: CyberBuild login.asp and browse0.htm cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2178.body: CyberOffice Warehouse Builder (CyberBuild) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by login.asp or browse0.htm. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'SessionID' or 'ProductIndex' parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2180.title: Golden FTP Server NLST and APPE command buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2180.body: Golden FTP Server Pro is vulnerable to a buffer overflow caused by improper handling of certain commands. By sending an overly long NLST or APPE command, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the FTP server to crash and disclose sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2181.title: Albinator Pro dlisting.php and showpic.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2181.body: Albinator Pro is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the dlisting.php and showpic.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'cid' or 'preloadSlideShow' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2197.title: wvWare wv2 library Word document integer overflow
CVE-2006-2197.body: The wvWare wv2 library is vulnerable to an integer overflow in the word_helper.h file. If a remote attacker could persuade a victim to open a specially-crafted Microsoft Word document with an application that utilizes the wv2 library, the attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the victim's system.Upgrade to the latest version of wv2 (0.2.3 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1100-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-300-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-24 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-2198.title: OpenOffice.org macro code execution
CVE-2006-2198.body: OpenOffice.org could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of BASIC macros embedded within documents. A remote attacker could create an OpenOffice document containing a malicious macro which, once the document is opened, would be automatically executed on the victim's system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious OpenOffice document to a potential victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site.Refer to OpenOffice.org Security Bulletin 2006-06-29 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1104-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102490 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0573-10 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:040 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2219.title: phpBB memberlist.php and viewtopic.php path disclosure
CVE-2006-2219.body: phpBB could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL requests to the memberlist.php or viewtopic.php script using the 'mode' or 'highlight' variables to cause phpBB to display the installation path and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2220.title: phpBB memberlist.php and viewtopic.php path disclosure
CVE-2006-2220.body: phpBB could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL requests to the memberlist.php or viewtopic.php script using the 'mode' or 'highlight' variables to cause phpBB to display the installation path and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2223.title: Quagga RIPv1 SEND UPDATE information disclosure
CVE-2006-2223.body: Quagga could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a RIPv1 SEND UPDATE request to cause RIPv2 routing table information to be returned. This information could be used to launch further attacks against the affected system and network.Upgrade to the latest Quagga release candidate (0.98 20060504 or later) or (0.99 20060504 or later), available from the Quagga Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0525-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Zebra):Refer to RHSA-2006:0533-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-15 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-2224.title: Quagga RIPd RIPv1 RESPONSE route injection security bypass
CVE-2006-2224.body: Quagga could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. If RIPv2 authentication is enabled, RIPv1 RESPONSE packets are accepted for updating the routing state. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to inject arbitrary routes into RIPd.Upgrade to the latest Quagga release candidate (0.98 20060504 or later) or (0.99 20060504 or later), available from the Quagga Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0525-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Zebra):Refer to RHSA-2006:0533-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-05-15 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-2238.title: Apple QuickTime BMP buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2238.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of malformed BMP image files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted BMP file to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system or cause the victim's QuickTime application to crash.Apply the Apple QuickTime 7.1 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2239.title: Newsadmin readarticle.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-2239.body: Newsadmin is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the readarticle.php script using the 'nid' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2245.title: phpbb-Auction module auction_common.php file include
CVE-2006-2245.body: phpbb-Auction could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to auction_common.php script using the phpbb_root_path variable to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2259.title: Maxx Schedule logon.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-2259.body: Maxx Schedule is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the Logon.asp script using the 'txtLogon' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2268.title: Flexcustomer Usercheek SQL injection
CVE-2006-2268.body: Flexcustomer is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the usercheek.php script using the username or password parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2268.title: FlexCustomer login SQL injection
CVE-2006-2268.body: FlexCustomer is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to admin/index.php and index.php scripts using the 'username' or 'password' parameter, which could allow the attacker to bypass authentication or view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2281.title: X-Poll add.php file upload
CVE-2006-2281.body: X-Poll could allow a remote attacker to upload malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the /admin/images/add.php script to upload a malicious file, which would be executed once the file is accessed.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2286.title: Dokeos /testheaderpage.php and /resourcelinker.inc.php file include
CVE-2006-2286.body: Dokeos Learning Management System could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the claroline/exercice/testheaderpage.php script or to the claroline/resourcelinker/resourcelinker.inc.php script using the 'rootSys' or 'clarolineRepositorySys' parameters to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the current version of Dokeos (version 1.6.4) or Dokeos Community Release (version 2.0.3) available from the Dokeos Learning Management System Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2297.title: Microsoft Infotech Storage System Library (itss.dll) CHM file heap corruption
CVE-2006-2297.body: The Microsoft Infotech Storage System Library (itss.dll) is vulnerable to a heap corruption. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system, if the attacker could persuade a victim to decompile a malicious CHM file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2301.title: OzzyWork Galeri admin_default.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-2301.body: OzzyWork Galeri is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the admin_default.asp script using the 'id' or 'password' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2312.title: Skype URI handler file access
CVE-2006-2312.body: Skype running on Microsoft Windows operating systems could allow a remote attacker access to an arbitrary file caused by a vulnerability in the URI handler. If a remote attacker was provided a link for downloading a file from the target victim, the remote attacker could modify the URI link to download an arbitrary file from the victim's system. The Skype file transfer dialogue box will appear when the malicious URI link is clicked.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in the SKYPE SECURITY BULLETIN SKYPE-SB/2006-001. See References.

CVE-2006-2327.title: Novell NDPS/iPrint DPRPC library integer overflow
CVE-2006-2327.body: The Novell Distributed Print Services (NDPS) DPRPC library is vulnerable to an integer overflow in the ndps_xdr_array() function. By sending a malformed request to a system running NDPS, iPrint, or iManager using the iPrint plugins, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the system to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.For Novell NetWare:Refer to Novell Technical Information Document TID2973700 for patch or upgrade information. See References.For Novell Client for Windows:Refer to Novell Technical Information Document TID2973719 for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-2337.title: D-Link DSL-G604T Wireless Router Directory Traversal
CVE-2006-2337.body: D-Link DSL-G604T Wireless Router could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories and obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted requests to /cgi-bin/webcm using "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the getpage variable to traverse directories and obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2341.title: Symantec Enterprise Firewall HTTP proxy internal IP disclosure
CVE-2006-2341.body: Symantec Enterprise Firewall and Symantec Gateway Security could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an information leak in the HTTP proxy. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request to a vulnerable device to cause internal IP addresses to be returned. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against systems protected by an affected device.Refer to Symantec Security Advisory SYM06-009 for upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-2351.title: Ipswitch WhatsUp Professional Navigation.asp and ToolResults.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2351.body: Ipswitch WhatsUp Professional is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the NmConsole/Navigation.asp and NmConsole/ToolResults.asp scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'sDeviceView' or 'sHostname' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2353.title: Ipswitch WhatsUp Professional DeviceSelection.asp user redirect
CVE-2006-2353.body: Ipswitch WhatsUp Professional could allow a remote attacker to redirect a victim to another site, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the NmConsole/DeviceSelection.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'sCancelURL' or' sRedirectURL' parameter to redirect a user to a malicious Web site.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2356.title: Ipswitch WhatsUp Professional RenderMap.asp information disclosure
CVE-2006-2356.body: Ipswitch WhatsUp Professional could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the NmConsole/utility/RenderMap.asp script. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an invalid 'nDeviceGroupID' parameter to obtain network node information. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2369.title: RealVNC authentication bypass
CVE-2006-2369.body: RealVNC Free Edition, Personal Edition, and Enterprise Edition could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access to the system. This is caused by the improper validation of the client authentication method which could allow an attacker to successfully authenticate to an affected system using the null authentication method.Upgrade to the latest version of RealVNC Free Edition, Personal Edition or Enterprise Edition, available from the RealVNC Web site. See References.For AdderLink IP:Upgrade to the latest firmware version (3.3 or later), available from the Adder Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2374.title: Microsoft Windows SMB invalid handle denial of service
CVE-2006-2374.body: Microsoft Windows is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by errors in the Microsoft Client Side Caching (CSCDLL.DLL) and Microsoft Server Message Block Redirector Driver (MRXSMB.SYS) files. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the system to stop responding.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2376.title: Microsoft Windows Graphics Rendering Engine (GRE) WMF code execution
CVE-2006-2376.body: Multiple could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of Windows Metafile (WMF) images by the Graphics Rendering Engine (GRE). By creating a malicious WMF image and sending it to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code and gain complete control of the affected system, once the malicious image is opened.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-026. See References.

CVE-2006-2379.title: Microsoft Windows TCP/IP protocol driver buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2379.body: Microsoft Windows is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the TCP/IP Protocol driver related to IP source routing. By sending a specially-crafted packet to an affected system, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2380.title: Microsoft Windows RPC mutual authentication spoofing
CVE-2006-2380.body: The RPC client in Microsoft Windows could allow a remote attacker to spoof a legitimate RPC service, caused by a vulnerability regarding the user of mutual authentication over Secure Socket Layer (SSL). A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to persuade a victim into connecting to a malicious RPC service that appears to be legitimate.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2382.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer UTF8 encoded HTML code execution
CVE-2006-2382.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, caused by a memory corruption vulnerability regarding the handling of UTF-8 encoded HTML. By creating a malicious Web page containing specially-crafted UTF-8 encoded HTML, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary commands on a victim's system with privileges of the victim, if the attacker could persuade a victim to visit the malicious page.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2384.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Address bar spoofing
CVE-2006-2384.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to display spoofed content in a browser window that displays a modal dialog box. A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted Web page which would display a URL specified by the attacker in the Address bar, while displaying a different Web site in the browser window. The attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2385.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer .mht files code execution
CVE-2006-2385.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code. Internet Explorer does not properly save multipart HTML (.mht) files. By creating a malicious Web page and persuading the victim to save the Web page as a .mht file, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code on a victim's system with privileges of the victim.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2388.title: Microsoft Excel cell rebuilding code execution
CVE-2006-2388.body: Microsoft Excel could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system. By creating a specially-crafted Excel file containing malformed cell comments, a remote attacker could cause memory corruption and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the user, once the file is opened and Excel attempts to rebuild the malformed cells. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2389.title: Microsoft Office property field buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2389.body: Microsoft Office is vulnerable to a buffer overflow. By creating a malicious Office file containing a specially-crafted property field, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the user, once the malicious file is opened. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or hosting it on a Web site.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-2395.title: PopPhoto /popp.config.loader.inc.php file include
CVE-2006-2395.body: PopPhoto could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the resources/includes/popp.config.loader.inc.php script using the "cfg['popphoto_base_path']" variable to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of PopPhoto (3.6.1 or later), available from the PopPhoto Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2399.title: Outgun data_file_request buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2399.body: Outgun is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the data_file_request command. By sending an overly long argument to the servnet.cpp file using the 'type' or 'name' string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2407.title: Multiple vendor SSH Server key exchange buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2407.body: Multiple vendor's SSH server software, including freeSSHd and the wodSSHServer ActiveX Component, are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of key exchange algorithm strings. By sending a specially-crafted key from an SSH client, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the system to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the affected system.For freeSSHd:Upgrade to the latest version (1.0.10 or later), available from the freeSSHd Web site. See References.For wodSSHServer ActiveX Component:Upgrade to the latest vesion (1.3.4 or later), available from the WeOnlyDo Software Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2408.title: Raydium raydium_log() and raydium_console_line_add() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2408.body: Raydium is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the raydium_log() and the raydium_console_line_add() functions. By sending a specially-crafted join request, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest SVN revision (310 or later), available from the Raydium Web site. See references.

CVE-2006-2416.title: e107 cookie SQL injection
CVE-2006-2416.body: e107 is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the 'e107_cookie' parameter, which could allow the attacker to obtain administrator access and possibly add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of e107 (0.7.4 or later), available from the e107 Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2417.title: phpMyAdmin theme parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2417.body: phpMyAdmin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'theme' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the current version of phpMyAdmin (2.8.0.4 or later) available from the phpMyAdmin Project Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2420.title: Bugzilla RSS title cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2420.body: Bugzilla is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input some Bugzilla RSS feeds. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an HMTL title tag in an RSS feed to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Bugzilla (2.18.4 or later), (2.20 or later) or (2.21.1 or later), as listed in the Bugzilla Security Advisory dated February 20, 2006. See References.

CVE-2006-2431.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server FAULTACTOR cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2431.body: IBM WebSphere Application Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input passed to the 500 Internal Server Error page on SOAP port 8880. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the FAULTACTOR element to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the latest WebSphere Application Server Cumulative Fix Pack (5.0.2.17 or later) or (6.0.2.9 or later), available from the IBM Support & downloads Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2439.title: ZipCentral ZIP archive filename buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2439.body: ZipCentral is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow caused by improper bounds checking of file names. By creating a malicious ZIP archive containing an overly long file name, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, once the malicious ZIP file is extracted.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2482.title: ZipTV TZipTV ARJ header buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2482.body: The TZipTV component in ZipTV is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of large ARJ headers. By sending an ARJ archive with an overly large header block, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system when the malicious archive is opened.Upgrade to the latest version of ZipTV (8.5.1.232 or later), available from the ZipTV Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2490.title: Mobotix multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2490.body: Mobotix is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the 'help', 'event player' or 'events.tar' script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.For Camera Model M22:Upgrade to the latest version (V3.0.3.31) available from the Software Downloads page of the Mobotix IP Network Cameras Web site. See References.For Camera Model M10/D10:Upgrade to the latest version (V2.2.3.18) available from the Software Downloads page of the Mobotix IP Network Cameras Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2506.title: Sphider search.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2506.body: Sphider is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Sphider (1.3.1c or later), available from the Sphider Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2521.title: phpMyDirectory ROOT_PATH file include
CVE-2006-2521.body: phpMyDirectory could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the cron.php, template/default/footer.php, template/Yellow/footer.php, defaults_setup.php, and template/default/test/header.php script using the 'ROOT_PATH' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from the local or a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of phpMyDirectory (10.4.5 or later), available from the phpMyDirectory Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2530.title: Snitz Forums avatar module file upload
CVE-2006-2530.body: Snitz Forums Avatar MOD could allow a remote attacker to upload malicious ASP files. A remote attacker with administrator access on the forum, could bypass security restrictions and use the avatar_upload.asp function to upload a malicious ASP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system with the privileges of the Web server.Refer to the Snitz Forums Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-2535.title: Destiney Links Script index.php path disclosure
CVE-2006-2535.body: Destiney Links Script could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script containing an invalid 'show' parameter to cause an error to be returned that displays the full installation path for the application. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2545.title: Xtremescripts Topsites stats.php, join.php, and lostid.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2545.body: Topsites from Xtremescripts is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the stats.php, join.php, and lostid.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2548.title: Perlpodder dlset command execution
CVE-2006-2548.body: Perlprodder could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by embedding arbitrary shell commands within the 'dlset' variable in a malicious XML page, which would be executed with the privileges of the victim, if the attacker could persuade the victim to download a malicious Podcast.Upgrade to the latest version of Perlpodder (0.5 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.

CVE-2006-2548.title: Prodder enc_url command execution
CVE-2006-2548.body: Prodder could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by embedding arbitrary shell commands within the 'enc_url' variable in a malicious XML page, which would be executed with the privileges of the victim, if the attacker could persuade the victim to download a malicious Podcast.Upgrade to the latest version of Prodder (0.5 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.

CVE-2006-2613.title: Mozilla window.sidebar.addSearchEngine() JavaScript exception path disclosure
CVE-2006-2613.body: Mozilla Firefox, Mozilla Suite, and Netscape could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could create a malicious Web page that makes a call to the window.sidebar.addSearchEngine() JavaScript function using invalid arguments, which would cause a JavaScript exception to occur that would disclose the full installation path or full path to the victim's user profile.Refer to the Mozilla Web site for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-2618.title: HyperStop Web Host Directory "write a review" cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2618.body: HyperStop Web Host Directory is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the 'write a review' field. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in an administrator's Web browser when the review is viewed, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2618.title: AlstraSoft Web Host Directory "write a review" cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2618.body: AlstraSoft Web Host Directory is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the 'write a review' field. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in an administrator's Web browser when the review is viewed, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2636.title: NewsCMSLite newsadmin.asp security bypass
CVE-2006-2636.body: NewsCMSLite could allow a remote attacker to bypass security caused by weak authentication in newsadmin.asp. A remote attacker could set the 'loggerIn' parameter in the cookie to a known default value to access the admin page.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2645.title: Plume CMS /manager/frontinc/prepend.php file include
CVE-2006-2645.body: Plume CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the /manager/frontinc/prepend.php script using the '_PX_config[manager_path]' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Plume CMS (1.0.4 or later), available from the Plume CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2645.title: Plume CMS prepend.php file include
CVE-2006-2645.body: Plume CMS could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the prepend.php script using the '_PX_config[manager_path]' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote or local system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Plume CMS (1.0.4 or later), available from the Plume CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2649.title: CosmicShoppingCart search.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2649.body: CosmicShoppingCart is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'query' and 'max' parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2663.title: iFlance multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2663.body: iFlance is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the acc_verify.php, admincp/login.php, account/login.php, and action/create.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'vk' parameter in acc_verify.php, the 'adminU' parameter in admincp/login.php, the 'user' and 'pass' parameters in account/login.php, and to the 'project_name' parameter in action/create.php to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2681.title: Socketmail index.php file include
CVE-2006-2681.body: Socketmail could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the 'site_path' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Socketmail (2.2.7 or later), available from the SocketMail Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2685.title: BASE BASE_path file include
CVE-2006-2685.body: Basic Analysis and Security Engine (BASE) could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the base_qry_common.php, base_stat_common.php or base_include.inc.php script using the 'BASE_path' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of BASE (1.2.5 or later), available from the BASE Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2686.title: ActionApps GLOBALS[AA_INC_PATH] file include
CVE-2006-2686.body: ActionApps could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using GLOBALS[AA_INC_PATH] parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of ActionApps (2.10.0 or later), available from the ActionApps Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2760.title: 4nForum PHP-Nuke module SQL injection
CVE-2006-2760.body: The 4nForum module for php-NUKE is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the 4nForum modules.php script using the 'tid' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2767.title: Ottoman "default_path" file include
CVE-2006-2767.body: Ottoman could allow a remote attacker to include malicious PHP files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the error.php, index.php or classes/main_class.php script using the 'default_path' parameter to specify a malicious PHP file from a remote system, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Ottoman (1.1.3 or later), available from the Ottoman Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2769.title: Snort uricontent rule bypass
CVE-2006-2769.body: Snort could allow a remote attacker to bypass uricontent rules and possibly evade detection. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL request containing a carriage return before the HTTP protocol declaration.Upgrade to the latest version of Snort (2.4.5 - 2.6.0 or later), available from the Snort Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2775.title: Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird XUL attribute code execution
CVE-2006-2775.body: Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Thunderbird could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system, caused by a vulnerability regarding XUL attributes. If a remote attacker could cause an incorrect URL to become associated with a persisted XUL attribute, the attacker could possibly execute arbitrary JavaScript on a victim's system with the same privileges as the browser. An attacker would have to persuade a victim to visit a malicious Web site in order to exploit this vulnerability. Note: Thunderbird is not affected by this vulnerability unless JavaScript in mail is enabled.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-35 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2779.title: Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird browser engine memory corruption
CVE-2006-2779.body: Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Thunderbird are vulnerable to multiple memory corruption issues in the browser engine related to nested options, DOMNodeRemoved mutation events, Content-implemented tree views, BoxObjects, XBL implementation, iframes and jsstr tagify. These issues could be exploited via a malicious Web page to execute arbitrary code or cause a victim's browser to crash.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-32 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2780.title: Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird browser engine memory corruption
CVE-2006-2780.body: Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Thunderbird are vulnerable to multiple memory corruption issues in the browser engine related to nested options, DOMNodeRemoved mutation events, Content-implemented tree views, BoxObjects, XBL implementation, iframes and jsstr tagify. These issues could be exploited via a malicious Web page to execute arbitrary code or cause a victim's browser to crash.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-32 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2781.title: Mozilla Thunderbird and SeaMonkey VCard double-free memory corruption
CVE-2006-2781.body: Mozilla Thunderbird and Mozilla SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by a double-free memory corruption vulnerability when processing specially-crafted VCards. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a malicious VCard containing invalid base64 encoded characters, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the victim's system, once the malicious VCard is opened.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-39 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2782.title: Mozilla Firefox textbox input control unauthorized file access
CVE-2006-2782.body: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to read arbitrary files from a victim's system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using a text box as a file upload control or modifying the input control in an event handler on a malicious Web site to read any known file on a victim's system, if the attacker could persuade a potential victim to visit the site. Note: This is a variation of the vulnerability originally reported in Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-23.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-41 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1120-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1118-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1134-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0609-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 2.1(Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0594-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to RHSA-2006:0611-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Firefox):Refer to RHSA-2006:0610-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2783.title: Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird BOM UTF-8 encoded cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2783.body: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to perform cross-site scripting attacks, caused by improper conversion of Unicode Byte-order-Mark (BOM) on UTF-8 encoded Web pages. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary script in a victim's browser within the security context of the affected Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-42 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1120-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1118-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1134-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0609-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 2.1(Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0594-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to RHSA-2006:0611-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Firefox):Refer to RHSA-2006:0610-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-2784.title: Mozilla Firefox PLUGINSPAGE code execution variant
CVE-2006-2784.body: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions and execute arbitrary JavaScript on a victim's system, caused by a vulnerability regarding nested JavaScript URLs in a PLUGINSPAGE attribute. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page and then clicking on the "missing-plugin" icon on the page or the "Install Missing Plugins" infobar item and choosing the "Manual Install" button. Note: This is a variation of the vulnerability originally described in Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2005-34.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-36 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1120-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1118-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1134-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0609-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 2.1(Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0594-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to RHSA-2006:0611-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Firefox):Refer to RHSA-2006:0610-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2796.title: Captivate gallery.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2796.body: Captivate is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the gallery.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'page' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2803.title: PHP ManualMaker search.php and index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2803.body: PHP ManualMaker is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input the search.php and index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 's' or 'id' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2815.title: Simpleboard multiple cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2815.body: Simpleboard from Two Shoes M-Factory (TSMF) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple modules. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'Name' field in 'post ne topic' of the Frontend, the Title (Community-Title) and the Name (Forum-Title) fields in Simpleboard Configuration in the Backend Admin Panel, the Name (Category-Title) fields in Simpleboard Administration in the Backend Admin Panel, and possibly the 'sb_authorname' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2816.title: coolphp magazine index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2816.body: coolphp magazine is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using multiple variables to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2852.title: dotWidget CMS "file_path" parameter file include
CVE-2006-2852.body: dotWidget CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php, feedback.php or printfriendly.php script using 'file_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2860.title: WebspotBlogging "path" file include
CVE-2006-2860.body: WebspotBlogging could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the logincheck.inc.php, adminheader.inc.php, global.php or mainheader.inc.php script using the 'path' parameter to specify an arbitrary file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2898.title: Asterisk IAX2 channel driver truncated video frame buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2898.body: Asterisk is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the IAX2 channel driver (chan_iax2). By sending a specially-crafted IAX2 video frame to UDP port 4569 on a vulnerable system, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the system to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the Asterisk daemon.Upgrade to the latest version of Asterisk (1.2.9.1 or later) or (1.0.11.1 or later), available from the Asterisk Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-15 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1126-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-2918.title: Lanap BotDetect ASP.NET CAPTCHA security bypass
CVE-2006-2918.body: Lanap BotDetect ASP.NET could allow a remote attacker to bypass the CAPTCHA implementation. CAPTCHA (Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart) is a test tool used to determine if a request is from a human user or has been automated. The CAPTCHA component uses the page viewState to store the UUID and hash for a given CAPTCHA. An attacker could replay a viewState of a known number to bypass the CAPTCHA security feature.Upgrade to the latest version of Lanap BotDetect (1.5.4.0 or later), available from the Lanap Software Web site. See References

CVE-2006-2920.title: Sylpheed-Claws src/common/utils.c and src/textview.c security bypass
CVE-2006-2920.body: Sylpheed-Claws could allow a remote attacker to bypass security caused by improper validation in the 'src/common/utils.c' and 'src/textview.c' scripts. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URI starting with a space character to bypass phishing restrictions.Upgrade to the latest version of Sylpheed-Claws (2.2.2 or later), available from the Sylpheed-Claws Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-2923.title: Multiple vendor IAXclient library truncated frame buffer overflow
CVE-2006-2923.body: The IAXclient library, which is used by multiple vendors to implement the IAX2 VoIP protocol, is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows, caused by improper handling of truncated frames. By sending specially-crafted truncated full-frame or mini-frame UDP packets to a vulnerable application, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer to cause the affected application to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the affected system.For iaxComm:Upgrade to the latest version (1.2.0 or later), available from the iaxComm Web site. See References.For Kiax:Upgrade to the latest version (0.8.51 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.For IDE FISK:Upgrade to the latest version (1.37 or later), available from asterisKGuru.com. See References.For LoudHush:Upgrade to the latest version (1.3.7 or later), available from the LoudHush Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Kiax):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-30 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-2936.title: Linux kernel usb/serial/ftdi_sio.c denial of service
CVE-2006-2936.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of queued data by the ftdi_sio (USB FTDI SIO) driver. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the consumption of all available memory resources by writing an excessive amount of data to the serial port.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux kernel (2.6.16.27 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0617-15 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1184-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux (kernel):Refer to SUSE-SA:2007:018 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux (kernel):Refer to SUSE-SA:2007:021 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux (kernel):Refer to SUSE-SA:2007:030 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux (kernel):Refer to SUSE-SA:2007:035 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-2937.title: OpenSSL ASN.1 error denial of service
CVE-2006-2937.body: OpenSSL is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper handling of an ASN.1 error condition. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an invalid ASN.1 request to cause an infinite loop condition that would consume all available memory resources.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSL (0.9.7l or 0.9.8d or later), as listed in OpenSSL Security Advisory [28th September 2006]. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-353-1 for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For FreeBSD:Refer to FreeBSD-SA-06:23.openssl for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1185-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0695-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Kolab Server:Refer to Kolab Security Issue 11 20061002 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to MDKSA-2006:172-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For OpenVPN:Refer to OpenVPNT 2.0.x Change Log for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200610-11 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For VMware Workstation:Upgrade to the latest version of VMware Workstation (6.0.3 or later), available from the VMware Workstation Web site. See References.For VMware Server:Upgrade to the latest version of VMware Server (1.0.5 or later), available from the VMware Server Web site. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:058 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP Tru64 UNIX (OpenSSL):Refer to HPSBTU02207 SSRT061239 rev.2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP System Management Homepage:Refer to HPSBMA02250 SSRT061275 rev.1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Xerox:Refer to XEROX SECURITY BULLETIN XRX07-001 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-2940.title: OpenSSL X.509 public key denial of service
CVE-2006-2940.body: OpenSSL is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by improper handling of X.509 certificates. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a message signed with a specially-crafted RSA key to consume a large amount of system resources, resulting in a denial of service.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSL (0.9.7l or 0.9.8d or later), as listed in OpenSSL Security Advisory [28th September 2006]. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-353-1 for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For FreeBSD:Refer to FreeBSD-SA-06:23.openssl for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1185-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0695-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Kolab Server:Refer to Kolab Security Issue 11 20061002 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP Tru64 UNIX (OpenSSL):Refer to HPSBTU02207 SSRT061239 rev.2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Xerox:Refer to XEROX SECURITY BULLETIN XRX07-001 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-2950.title: Net Portal Dynamic System (NPDS) multiple .php scripts path disclosure
CVE-2006-2950.body: Net Portal Dynamic System (NPDS) could disclose sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted request to the header.php, contact.php, or forum_extender.php scripts to cause an error message to be returned containing the installation path.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2977.title: mafia moblog big.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-2977.body: mafia moblog is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the big.php script using the 'img' parameter, which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-2994.title: Phaziz Guestbook multiple fields cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-2994.body: Phaziz Guestbook is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input passed to the 'Name', 'Email', 'Text', or 'Website' form fields. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using HTML IMG tags to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Phaziz Guestbook (2.1 or later), available from the Phaziz Guestbook Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3011.title: PHP error_log() safe mode bypass
CVE-2006-3011.body: PHP could allow a remote attacker to bypass safe mode restrictions, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the error_log() function. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a php:// request containing directory traversal sequences (../) as a destination argument to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized access to arbitrary files on Web servers that are running an affected version of PHP.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (4.4.3 or later), available from the The PHP Group Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3015.title: WinSCP scp:// and sftp:// URI handler command execution
CVE-2006-3015.body: WinSCP could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on a victim's system, caused by improper validation of scp:// and sftp:// links. If an attacker could persuade a victim to follow a specially-crafted scp:// or sftp:// URL on a malicious Web site, the attacker could cause the victim to download a malicious file allowing the attacker to execute arbitrary commands or corrupt arbitrary files on the victim's system.Upgrade to the latest version of WinSCP (3.8.2 or later), available from the WinSCP Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3047.title: TikiWiki multiple unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3047.body: TikiWiki is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by multiple unspecified scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of TikiWiki (1.9.4 or later), available from the TikiWiki Download page. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-29 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3048.title: TikiWiki unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2006-3048.body: TikiWiki is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to an unspecified script which could allow the attacker to add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of TikiWiki (1.9.4 or later), available from the TikiWiki Download page. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-06-29 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3061.title: Five Star edit profile cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3061.body: Five Star Review is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the profile_edit1.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various form fields to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Five Star Review, available from the Five Star Review Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3061.title: Five Star Review search_reviews.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3061.body: Five Star Review is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search_reviews.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the search parameter execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Five Star Review, available from the Five Star Review Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3061.title: Five Star Review report.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3061.body: Five Star Review is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the report.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'item_id' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Five Star Review, available from the Five Star Review Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3061.title: Five Star Review index2.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3061.body: Five Star Review is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index2.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'sort' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Five Star Review, available from the Five Star Review Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3074.title: Kaspersky Anti-Virus multiple klif.sys denial of service
CVE-2006-3074.body: Multiple Kaspersky Anti-Virus products are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the klif.sys driver's NtCreateKey, NtCreateProcess, NtCreateProcessEx, NtCreateSection, NtCreateSymbolicLinkObject, NtCreateThread, NtLoadKey2, NtOpenKey, and NtOpenProcess functions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to crash the system.Refer to Kapersky Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3082.title: GnuPG parse-packet.c buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3082.body: GNU Privacy Guard (GnuPG or GPG) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the parse_user_id() function in the parse-packet.c file. By sending an overly long user ID, a local or remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the GnuPG CVS Repository. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1107-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (GnuPG2):Refer to DSA-1115-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0571-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For OpenPKG:Refer to OpenPKG Security Advisory OpenPKG-SA-2006.010 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-3086.title: Microsoft Office hlink.dll COM object buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3086.body: Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of hyperlinks by the hlink.dll library. By creating a malicious Office document containing a specially-crafted hyperlink, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system if the attacker could persuade a potential victim to open the malicious document and click the specially-crafted link.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-050. See References.

CVE-2006-3087.title: EZGallery multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3087.body: EZGallery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the common/galleries.asp, common/pupload.asp, and common/upload.asp scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using various parameters to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3117.title: OpenOffice.org XML document buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3117.body: OpenOffice.org is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of XML documents. By creating a malformed OpenOffice XML document and hosting it on a Web site or sending it to a potential victim as an email attachment, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the affected application to crash, once the document is opened.Refer to OpenOffice.org Security Bulletin 2006-06-29 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1104-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102501 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0573-10 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:040 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-3138.title: phpMyDirectory multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3138.body: phpMyDirectory is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'PIC' parameter in the offers-pix.php script, the 'from' parameter in the cp/index.php script or the 'action' parameter in the cp/admin_index.php script to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the phpMyDirectory Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-3139.title: Virtual War (vWar) war.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-3139.body: Virtual War (vWar) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the war.php script using the s, page, showgame or sortby parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3139.title: Virtual War war.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-3139.body: Virtual War (VWar) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the war.php script using the s, showgame, sortorder, sortby, or page parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3144.title: Micro CMS microcms-include.php file include
CVE-2006-3144.body: Micro CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the microcms-include.php script using the microcms_path parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3144.title: Micro-CMS microcms-include.php file include
CVE-2006-3144.body: Micro-CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the microcms-include.php script using the 'microcms_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3146.title: Toshiba Bluetooth Stack L2CAP echo request denial of service
CVE-2006-3146.body: The Toshiba Bluetooth Stack for Windows is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a buffer overflow in the TOSRFBD.SYS driver. By sending overly large L2CAP echo requests to an affected system, a remote attacker with knowledge or the Bluetooth device address could overflow a buffer and cause the system to reboot.Per private correspondence, install Bluetooth Service Pack 2 for the v4 Toshiba Bluetooth stack, available from the Toshiba Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3172.title: Content-Builder (CMS) multiple file include
CVE-2006-3172.body: Content-Builder (CMS) could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary remote files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the 'lang_path', 'path[cb]' or 'rel' parameters to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3175.title: mcGuestbook multiple scripts "lang" parameter file include
CVE-2006-3175.body: mcGuestbook could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the admin.php, ecrire.php or lire.php script using the 'lang' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3181.title: MobeSpace index.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-3181.body: MobeSpace is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the 'browse' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3210.title: Ralf Image Gallery "dir_abs_src" and "dir_abs_admin_src" file include
CVE-2006-3210.body: Ralf Image Gallery (RIG) could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the check_entry.php script using the 'dir_abs_src' parameter or the admin_album.php, admin_image.php or admin_util.php script using the 'dir_abs_admin_src' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of Ralf Image Gallery (1.0 or later) in order to fix the check_entry.php script.

CVE-2006-3210.title: Ralf Image Gallery "dir_abs_src" and "dir_abs_admin_src" cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3210.body: Ralf Image Gallery (RIG) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in the check_entry.php script using the 'dir_abs_src' parameter or the admin_album.php, admin_image.php and admin_util.php scripts using the 'dir_abs_admin_src' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Ralf Image Gallery (1.0 or later) in order to fix the check_entry.php script.

CVE-2006-3210.title: Ralf Image Gallery "dir_abs_src" and "dir_abs_admin_src" directory traversal
CVE-2006-3210.body: Ralf Image Gallery (RIG) could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system.
