If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the check_entry.php, admin_album.php, admin_image.php or admin_util.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the 'dir_abs_src' or 'dir_abs_admin_src' parameter, which would allow the attacker to traverse directories and view any known file on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Ralf Image Gallery (1.0 or later) in order to fix the check_entry.php script.

CVE-2006-3251.title: Hashcash array_push() function buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3251.body: Hashcash is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the array_push() function in hashcash.c. By sending a large number of -r or -j command line options or a large number of resource names using the -m command line option, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Upgrade to the latest version of Hashcash (1.21 or later), available from the Hashcash Web site. See Refrerences.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to GLSA 200606-25 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1114-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-3277.title: MailEnable SMTP HELO denial of service
CVE-2006-3277.body: MailEnable Enterprise, Professional, and Standard editions are vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by an unspecified error in the SMTP service. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted HELO command to cause the SMTP service to crash.Apply Hotfix ME-10013, available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3281.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTA SMB file share command execution
CVE-2006-3281.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute HTA files (HTML Applications) on a victim's system. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a Web page containing a link to an SMB file share filename with encoded '..\' (%2e%2e%5c) sequences, which could allow the attacker to execute HTA files on a victim's system with the permissions of the victim, if a victim could be persuaded to double-click in the malicious page. It may be possible for an attacker to use this vulnerability and gain complete control over the victim's system.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-045. See References.For Windows XP SP1:Microsoft originally provided a patch for this vulnerability in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS03-045, but it has been superseded by the patch released with Microsoft Security Bulletin MS05-057. See References.For Windows XP SP2, Windows Server 2003, and Windows Server 2003 SP1:Note: Microsoft originally provided a patch for this vulnerability in MS06-045, but it was superseded by the patch released with MS07-006. See References.

CVE-2006-3306.title: Project EROS lib/common.php preparestring() cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3306.body: Project EROS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the preparestring() function in lib/common.php. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of project eros (20060622-0315 or later), available from the project eros Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3318.title: phpRaid register.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-3318.body: phpRaid is vulnerable to SQL injection. If the 'phpraid' authentication option is being used, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the register.php script using the 'username' or 'email' form fields, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of phpRaid (3.0.6 or later), available from the phpRaid Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3344.title: Siemens SpeedStream UPnP authentication bypass
CVE-2006-3344.body: Siemens SpeedStream 2624 wireless router could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access to restricted files. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the UPnP support interface, which does not require authentication.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3365.title: V3 Chat index.php path disclosure
CVE-2006-3365.body: V3 Chat could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using an invalid parameter to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.Apply the fix for this vulnerability, available from the V3 Chat Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3396.title: Galleria galleria.html.php file include
CVE-2006-3396.body: Galleria could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the galleria.html.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Refer to the Mambo Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-3401.title: Quake 3 engine CS_ITEMS buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3401.body: Multiple game servers based on the Quake 3 engine are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the CS_ITEMS module. By sending an overly long CS_ITEM value to a client, a remote attacker in control of a malicious game server could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a potential victim to connect to the malicious server.Apply the latest patch for this vulnerability (revision 812), available from the quake3 CVS repository. See References

CVE-2006-3423.title: WebEx ActiveX control DLL code execution
CVE-2006-3423.body: The WebEx ActiveX control could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system. WebEx uses ActiveX to download additional components needed to host or attend a Web conference. The additional components are not validated, nor the location from which they are downloaded. This could allow the attacker to create a malicious Web page that would initialize the WebEx ActiveX control, and download and initialize a DLL of their choice, once a victim visits the page. By placing malicious code in the initialization routine of the DLL, the attacker could execute arbitrary code under the security context of the user viewing the malicious Web page.Upgrade to the latest version of the WebEx ActiveX control for Microsoft Internet Explorer or Mozilla Firefox (2.1.0.0 or later), available from the WebEx Communications, Inc. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3430.title: PatchLink Update checkprofile.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-3430.body: PatchLink Update is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the /dagent/checkprofile.asp using the 'agentid' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of PatchLink Update (6.1 P3 or 6.2 SR1 P1 or later), available from the PatchLink Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3442.title: Microsoft Windows XP PGM buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3442.body: Microsoft Windows XP is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) protocol implementation. By sending a specially-crafted PGM message to a system with the Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) service installed, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer to execute arbitrary code and gain complete control of the affected system. Note: The MSMQ service is not installed by default.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-3445.title: Microsoft Agent .ACF file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3445.body: Microsoft Windows is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the Microsoft Agent. By creating a specially-crafted .ACF file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the victim. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious page on a Web site or sending it to a victim as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-068. See References.

CVE-2006-3448.title: Microsoft Step-by-Step Interactive Training bookmark link buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3448.body: Microsoft Step-by-Step Interactive Training is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of bookmark link files. By creating a malformed bookmark link (cbo, cbl, or cbm) file and persuading a victim to open the file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by hosting the malicious file on a Web site or sending the file as an email attachment.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS07-005. See References.

CVE-2006-3486.title: MySQL Instance Manager denial of service
CVE-2006-3486.body: The MySQL Instance Manager (IM) is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an off-by-one buffer overflow in the Instance_options::complete_initialization() function. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the Instance Manager to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of MySQL (5.0.23 or later) or (5.1.12 or later), available from the MySQL Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3494.title: Buddy Zone multiple scripts SQL injection
CVE-2006-3494.body: Buddy Zone is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the view_classifieds.php script using the 'cat_id' parameter, the view_ad.php script using the 'id' parameter, the view_event.php script using the 'event_id' parameter or the view_group.php script using the 'group_id' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Vastal I-Tech & Co. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3530.title: PcCookBook component for Joomla! file include
CVE-2006-3530.body: PcCookBook component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the pccookbook.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3539.title: Dragons Kingdom gameemail.php, dk.php and general.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3539.body: Dragons Kingdom is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the Subject and Message form fields in the gamemail.php script, the Gender, Country/Location, MSN Messenger, AOL Instant Messenger, Yahoo Instant Messenger, and ICQ form fields in the dk.php script and the Title and Message form fields in the general.php script to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3556.title: ExtCalendar extcalendar.php file include
CVE-2006-3556.body: ExtCalendar could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the extcalendar.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of ExtCalendar (2.0 or later), available from the ExtCalendar Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3561.title: BT Voyager 2091 Wireless ADSL configuration information disclosure
CVE-2006-3561.body: The BT Voyager 2091 Wireless ADSL router could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker, from within the same network segment, could send a direct request to the 'psiBackupInfo' or 'connect.html' files to obtain sensitive configuration and PPP user information. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected device or network.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3562.title: Plume CMS multiple scripts file include
CVE-2006-3562.body: Plume CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script, the rss.php script, and the search.php script using the '_PX_config[manager_path]' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3571.title: Papoo interna/hilfe.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3571.body: Papoo is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the interna/hilfe.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'titel' or 'ausgabe' parameter to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3581.title: AdPlug S3M file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3581.body: AdPlug is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of S3M files by the Cs3mPlayer::load function. By creating a malicious S3M file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a victim to open the malicious file.Apply the latest patch for this vulnerability (dated 05 Jul 2006 or later), available from the AdPlug CVS repository. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Audacious):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-13 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-06 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3581.title: AdPlug DTM file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3581.body: AdPlug is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of DTM files by the CdtmLoader::load function. By creating a malicious DTM file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a victim to open the malicious file.Apply the latest patch for this vulnerability (dated 05 Jul 2006 or later), available from the AdPlug CVS repository. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Audacious):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-13 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-06 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3582.title: AdPlug U6M file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3582.body: AdPlug is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of U6M files by the Cu6mPlayer::load function. By creating a malicious U6M file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a victim to open the malicious file.Apply the latest patch for this vulnerability (dated 05 Jul 2006 or later), available from the AdPlug CVS repository. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Audacious):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-13 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-06 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3582.title: AdPlug DMO file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3582.body: AdPlug is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of DMO files by the CdmoLoader::load function. By creating a malicious DMO file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a victim to open the malicious file.Apply the latest patch for this vulnerability (dated 05 Jul 2006 or later), available from the AdPlug CVS repository. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Audacious):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-13 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-06 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3600.title: libtunepimp LookupTRM::lookup() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3600.body: libtunepimp is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of overly long release dates by the LookupTRM::lookup() function. By sending a specially-crafted .mp3 file containing a long release date, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could convince the victim to open the malicious .mp3 file.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in MusicBrainz Ticket #1764 (bug). See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-11 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1135-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3627.title: Wireshark (Ethereal) GSM BSSMAP dissector denial of service
CVE-2006-3627.body: The GSM BSSMAP dissector in Wireshark (formerly known as Ethereal) is vulnerable to a denial of service. A remote attacker could exploit an unspecified vulnerability using a malformed packet or trace file to cause the GSM BSSMAP dissector to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Wireshark (0.99.2 or later), as listed in Wireshark Security Advisory wnpa-sec-2006-01. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0602-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3630.title: Wireshark (Ethereal) NCP NMAS and NDPS dissector off-by-one
CVE-2006-3630.body: Wireshark (formerly known as Ethereal) is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by multiple off-by-one errors in the NCP NMAS and NDPS dissectors. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malformed packet or trace file to cause the application to crash and possibly execute arbitrary commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Wireshark (0.99.2 or later), as listed in Wireshark Security Advisory wnpa-sec-2006-01. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1127-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0602-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3631.title: Wireshark (Ethereal) SSH dissector denial of service
CVE-2006-3631.body: Wireshark (formerly known as Ethereal) is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by in infinite loop in the SSH dissector. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malformed packet or trace file to cause the application to enter into an infinite loop and crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Wireshark (0.99.2 or later), as listed in Wireshark Security Advisory wnpa-sec-2006-01. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1127-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0602-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3632.title: Wireshark (Ethereal) NFS dissector buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3632.body: Wireshark (formerly known as Ethereal) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the NFS dissector. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malformed packet or trace file to cause the application to crash and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Wireshark (0.99.2 or later), as listed in Wireshark Security Advisory wnpa-sec-2006-01. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-07-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1127-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0602-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3633.title: OSSP shiela shell command execution
CVE-2006-3633.body: OSSP shiela could allow a remote attacker with access to a CVS server that uses OSSP sheila to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of filenames. A remote authenticated attacker could inject arbitrary shell commands via specially-crafted file names containing shell metacharacters, which would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server.Upgrade to the latest version of OSSP Shiela (1.1.7 or later), available from the OSSP Shiela Web site. See References.For OpenPKG:Refer to OpenPKG Security Advisory OpenPKG-SA-2006.014 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-3643.title: Microsoft Windows 2000 Management Console (MMC) resource file cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3643.body: Microsoft Windows 2000 Management Console (MMC) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper restrictions on certain embedded resource files used by the Microsoft Management Console library. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious Web site to gain unauthorized access to MMC embedded resource files and execute arbitrary code on the system with the victim's privileges, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit the malicious site.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS06-044. See References.

CVE-2006-3668.title: DUMB it_read_envelope() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3668.body: Dynamic Universal Music Bibliotheque (DUMB) is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of Impulse Tracker (IT) files by the it_read_envelope() function. By creating a malicious IT file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade a victim to open the malicious file.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1123-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-14 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-3733.title: Cisco CS-MARS JBoss command execution
CVE-2006-3733.body: Cisco Security Monitoring, Analysis and Response System (CS-MARS) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the device, caused by an insecure JBoss Web application server installation. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary shell commands with CS-MARS administrator privileges by sending a specially-crafted HTTP request to the JBoss JMX console, which is accessible without authentication.Upgrade to the latest version of the CS-MARS software (4.2.1 or later), as listed in cisco-sa-20060719-mars. See References.

CVE-2006-3738.title: OpenSSL SSL_get_shared_ciphers() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3738.body: OpenSSL is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the SSL_get_shared_ciphers() function. By sending an overly long list of ciphers to an application that uses the vulnerable function, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the server to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSL (0.9.7l or 0.9.8d or later), as listed in OpenSSL Security Advisory [28th September 2006]. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-353-1 for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For FreeBSD:Refer to FreeBSD-SA-06:23.openssl for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1185-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (openssl096):Refer to DSA-1195-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0695-12 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Kolab Server:Refer to Kolab Security Issue 11 20061002 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to MDKSA-2006:172-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For OpenVPN:Refer to OpenVPNT 2.0.x Change Log for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200610-11 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux AMD64 x86:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200612-11 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Cisco:Refer to cisco-sr-20061108-openssl for upgrade information. See References.For VMware:Refer to Full-Disclosure Mailing List, Tue Jan 9 02:17:36 GMT 2007 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:058 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP Tru64 UNIX (OpenSSL):Refer to HPSBTU02207 SSRT061239 rev.2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP System Management Homepage:Refer to HPSBMA02250 SSRT061275 rev.1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102711 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Xerox:Refer to XEROX SECURITY BULLETIN XRX07-001 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-3744.title: ImageMagick Sun Rasterfile image buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3744.body: ImageMagick is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the DecodeBitmap() and ReadSUNImage() functions in sun.c. By creating a malicious SunRasterfile image, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, if the attacker could persuade a victim to open the malicious image.Upgrade to the latest version of ImageMagick (version 6.2.9.1 or later), available from the ImageMagick Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1168-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-14 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:050 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-3747.title: Apache mod_rewrite off-by-one buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3747.body: The Rewrite module (mod_rewrite) for Apache HTTP Server could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an off-by-one buffer overflow in the escape_absolute_uri() LDAP scheme handling function. If RewriteRule is enabled and does not contain a Forbidden(F), Gone(G), or NoEscape(NE) flag, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the server to crash.For Apache 2.2.x:Upgrade to the latest version of Apache (2.2.3 or later), available from the Apache Web site. See References.For Apache 1.x:Upgrade to the latest version of Apache (1.3.37 or later), available from the Apache Web site. See References.For Apache 2.0.x:Upgrade to the latest version of Apache (2.2.0.59 or later), available from the Apache Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 2006-08-01 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1132-1 or DSA-1131-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For OpenPKG:Refer to OpenPKG Security Advisory OpenPKG-SA-2006.014 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Sun Solaris:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102662 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For WebSphere Application Server:Refer to IBM Support & downloads for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:043 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP System Management Homepage:Refer to HPSBMA02250 SSRT061275 rev.1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mac OS X 10.4.11, Mac OS X 10.5.2, Mac OS X Server 10.5.2:Apply Security Update 2008-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For Mac OS X Server 10.4.11:Apply Security Update 2008-003, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For HP OpenView Network Node Manager:Refer to HPSBMA02328 SSRT071293 rev.1 for patch information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-3748.title: LoudMouth component for Mambo com_loudmouth/includes/abbc/abbc.class.php file include
CVE-2006-3748.body: The LoudMouth component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the com_loudmouth/includes/abbc/abbc.class.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Refer to the Mambo Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-3749.title: Sitemap component for Mambo sitemap.xml.php file include
CVE-2006-3749.body: The Sitemap component for Mambo and Jomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the sitemap.xml.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Sitemap, available from the Mambo Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3750.title: Hashcash component for Joomla! server.php file include
CVE-2006-3750.body: The Hashcash component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the server.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Hashcash (1.2.2 or later), available from the Hashcash Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3751.title: ImageManager component for Joomla! config.inc file include
CVE-2006-3751.body: The ImageManager component for Joomla! and Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the config.inc.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3756.title: Geeklog comment.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3756.body: Geeklog is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the comment.php and lib-comment.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Geeklog (1.4.0sr5 or 1.3.11sr7 or later), available from the Geeklog Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3761.title: MyBB [url] tag cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-3761.body: MyBB is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using Unicode-encoded script embedded within [url] tags in a message posting to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of MyBB (1.1.5 or later), available from the MyBB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3773.title: SMF Forum component for Mambo and Joomla! smf.php file include
CVE-2006-3773.body: The SMF Forum component for Mambo and Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the smf.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Refer to Mambo Annoucements Forum, July 10th, 2006, 20:31 for suggested workaround. See References.

CVE-2006-3774.title: perForms component for Joomla performs.php file include
CVE-2006-3774.body: perForms as a component for Joomla could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the performs.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3775.title: MyBB CLIENT_IP SQL injection
CVE-2006-3775.body: MyBB is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the getip() function in the inc/functions.php script using the 'CLIENT_IP' variable, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of MyBB (version 1.1.6 or later), available from the MyBB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3776.title: PhpHostBot order/index.php file include
CVE-2006-3776.body: PhpHostBot and AutoHost could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the order/index.php script using the 'page' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of PhpHostBot (1.02 or later), available from the PhpHostBot Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3777.title: PhpLinkExchange index.php file include
CVE-2006-3777.body: PhpLinkExchange could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the 'page' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3806.title: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird and SeaMonkey JavaScript engine multiple integer overflows
CVE-2006-3806.body: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by multiple integer overflows in the JavaScript engine. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a malicious Web page that passes overly long strings to the toSource() method or other unspecified string functions and persuading a victim to visit the malicious Web page.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-50 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 2.1(Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0594-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 3 (Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0608-6 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4 (Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0609-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4 (Thunderbird):Refer to RHSA-2006:0611-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4 (Firefox):Refer to RHSA-2006:0610-4 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-04 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-03 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Seamonkey):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-02 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Firefox):Refer to DSA-1161-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Mozilla):Refer to DSA-1160-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1159-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:048 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-3838.title: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Anylyzer (ESA) Monitoring.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3838.body: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) is vulnerable to an unspecified buffer overflow in the Monitoring.exe service. By sending a specially-crafted command to TCP port 9999 or TCP ort 10626, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Enterprise Security Analyzer (2.5.0 or later), available from the eIQnetworks, Inc. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3838.title: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) Topology.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3838.body: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the Topology.exe service. By sending an overly long prefix to the GUIADDDEVICE, ADDDEVICE or DELETEDEVICE command on TCP port 10628, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Enterprise Security Analyzer (2.5.0 or later), available from the eIQnetworks, Inc. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3838.title: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) EnterpriseSecurityAnalyzer.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3838.body: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the EnterpriseSecurityAnalyzer.exe service when adding a new license. By sending an overly long LICMGR_ADDLICENSE command to TCP port 10616, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Enterprise Security Analyzer (2.5.0 or later), available from the eIQnetworks, Inc. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3838.title: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) SyslogServer.exe long command buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3838.body: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) is vulnerable to multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the Syslog daemon (SyslogServer.exe). By sending an overly long DELTAINTERVAL, LOGFOLDER, DELETELOGS, FWASERVER, SYSLOGPUBLICIP, GETFWAIMPORTLOG, GETFWADELTA, DELETERDEPDEVICE, COMPRESSRAWLOGFILE, GETSYSLOGFIREWALLS, ADDPOLICY or EDITPOLICY command to TCP port 10617, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Enterprise Security Analyzer (2.5.0 or later), available from the eIQnetworks, Inc. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3838.title: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) SyslogServer.exe long string buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3838.body: eIQnetworks Enterprise Security Analyzer (ESA) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the Syslog daemon (SyslogServer.exe). By sending overly long strings to the listening TCP port, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system. Note: The affected port is not exposed under the default configuration.Upgrade to the latest version of Enterprise Security Analyzer (2.5.0 or later), available from the eIQnetworks, Inc. Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3840.title: Internet Security Systems PAM SMB mailslot dos
CVE-2006-3840.body: Internet Security Systems July 2006 XPU release of the SMB_MailSlot_Heap_Overflow contains a protocol parsing vulnerability. The SMB_MailSlot_Heap_Overflow decode provides protection for the Microsoft SMB/TCP Mailslot vulnerability (MS06-035). A remote attacker can send certain types of legitimate SMB Mailsot traffic to cause the protocol analysis module (PAM) engine to stop responding. TCP port 445 at the firewall must be open in order for the attacker to exploit this vulnerability.Upgrade to the latest XPU (XPU 24.40) from the Internet Security Systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3847.title: Mospray component for Mambo admin.php file include
CVE-2006-3847.body: The Mospray component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the admin.php script using the 'basedir' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3904.title: Etomite CMS username field SQL injection
CVE-2006-3904.body: Etomite CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the manager/index.php script using the 'username' parameter, which could allow the attacker to bypass authentication or view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to the Etomite Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-3934.title: OpenCms downloadTrigger.jsp file access
CVE-2006-3934.body: OpenCms could allow a remote attacker access to sensitive files. By sending a specially-crafted request to the downloadTrigger.jsp using the 'filePath' parameter an authenticated remote attacker could access arbitrary files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenCms (6.2.2 or later), available from the OpenCms Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3942.title: Microsoft Windows SMB malformed PIPE denial of service
CVE-2006-3942.body: Multiple versions of Microsoft Windows are vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a NULL pointer dereference in the server driver (srv.sys). By sending a specially-crafted network packet to an affected system, a remote attacker could cause the system to crash.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-3946.title: Apple Safari KHTMLParser::popOneBlock() code execution
CVE-2006-3946.body: Apple Safari could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption vulnerability in the KHTMLParser::popOneBlock() function. By creating a malicious Web page containing a script element inside a div object that redefines the document body, a remote attacker could cause a victim's browser to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the victim's system, if the victim could be persuaded to visit the malicious site.For Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server:Apply Apple Security Update 2006-006 or Mac OS X 10.4.8 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3947.title: mambatStaff component for Mambo mambatstaff.php file include
CVE-2006-3947.body: The mambatStaff component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the mambatstaff.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Refer to the Mambo Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-3949.title: Artlinks component for Mambo and Joomla! dispnew.php file include
CVE-2006-3949.body: The Artlinks component for Mambo and Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the artlinks.dispnew.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3966.title: MyNewsGroups :) myng_root parameter file include
CVE-2006-3966.body: MyNewsGroups :) could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the lib/tree/layersmenu.inc.php script using the myng_root parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3980.title: Mambo Gallery Manager (MGM) component for Mambo help.mgm.php and about.mgm.php file include
CVE-2006-3980.body: The Mambo Gallery Manager (MGM) component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the help.mgm.php or the about.mgm.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Refer to the Mambo Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-3985.title: PowerArchiver add buffer overflow
CVE-2006-3985.body: PowerArchiver is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by DZIPS32.DLL when adding to an archived file. By creating a malicious archive file with an overlong filename of more than 2048 bytes, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the system to crash when the victim attempts to add to the malicious ZIP archive file.Upgrade to the latest version of PowerArchiver (9.63 or later), available from the PowerArchiver Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-3995.title: User Home Page component for Mambo uhp_config.php file include
CVE-2006-3995.body: The User Home Page component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the uhp_config.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-3995.title: User Home Pages (UHP) component for Mambo multiple scripts file include
CVE-2006-3995.body: The User Home Pages (UHP) component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: footer.php functions.php install.uhp.php toolbar.uhp.html.php uhp.class.php uhp_config.php uninstall.uhp.phpUpgrade to the latest version of UHP (0.7 or later), available from the UHP Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4006.title: BomberClone send_pkg() information disclosure
CVE-2006-4006.body: BomberClone could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information caused by a vulnerability in the send_pkg() function in packets.c. A remote attacker could send a packet containing a specially-crafted 'len' value to obtain sensitive information.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1180-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4010.title: Virtual War (vWar) war.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-4010.body: Virtual War (vWar) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the war.php script using the s, page, showgame or sortby parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4013.title: Symantec Brightmail AntiSpam invalid post denial of service
CVE-2006-4013.body: Symantec Brightmail AntiSpam (SBAS) is vulnerable to a denial of service attack. If the Control Center is allowed to connect from any computer, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted post to cause a denial of service.Refer to Symantec Security Response SYM06-012 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4013.title: Symantec Brightmail AntiSpam DATABLOB-GET and DATABLOB-SAVE file overwrite
CVE-2006-4013.body: Symantec Brightmail AntiSpam (SBAS) could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the server, caused by improper validation of filenames. If the Control Center is allowed to connect from any computer, a remote attacker could send a DATABLOB-GET or DATABLOB-SAVE request for a specially-crafted filename to traverse directories and view or overwrite arbitrary files on the system.Refer to Symantec Security Response SYM06-012 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4018.title: Clam AntiVirus pefromupx() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4018.body: Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the pefromupx() function in libclamav/upx.c. By sending a specially-crafted compressed UPX file in an email, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the service to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Clam AntiVirus (0.88.4 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-13 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1153-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:046 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-4026.title: SAPID CMS get_infochannel.inc.php and get_tree.inc.php file include
CVE-2006-4026.body: SAPID CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the get_infochannel.inc.php script using the 'root_path' parameter or to the get_tree.inc.php script using the 'GLOBALS[root_path]' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4038.title: GasteChaos eintragen.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-4038.body: GasteChaos is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the eintragen.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'gastname' or 'gastwohnort' input fields to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4039.title: GasteChaos eintragen.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-4039.body: GasteChaos is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to eintragen.php script using the 'gastname', 'gastwohnort' or the 'gasteintrag' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4042.title: myBloggie trackback.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-4042.body: myBloggie is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the trackback.php script using the 'title', 'url', 'excerpt' or 'blog_name' parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4064.title: YenerTurk Haber Script default.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-4064.body: YenerTurk Haber Script is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the default.asp script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4067.title: CakePHP error.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-4067.body: CakePHP is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the error.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script in the address bar, which would cause a "404 Not Found" error page to be returned to the victim and the embedded script to be executed in the victim's Web browser under the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of CakePHP (1.1.7.3363 or later), available from the CakePHP Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4074.title: JD-Wiki component for Joomla! main.php file include
CVE-2006-4074.body: JD-Wiki component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the main.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of JD-Wiki (1.0.3 or later), available from the Joomla Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4130.title: Remository component for Mambo and Joomla! admin.repository.php file include
CVE-2006-4130.body: The Remository component for Mambo and Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the admin.repository.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Remository (3.26 or later), available from the Remository Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4159.title: Chaussette _BASE file include
CVE-2006-4159.body: Chaussette could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the '_BASE' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: /Classes/Evenement.php /Classes/Event.php /Classes/Event_for_month.php /Classes/Event_for_month_per_day.php /Classes/Event_for_week.php /Classes/My_Log.php /Classes/My_Smarty.phpNo remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4183.title: Microsoft DirectX Targa buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4183.body: Microsoft DirectX is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow. By persuading a victim to preview or download a specially-crafted run-length encoded (RLE) Targa image file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Microsoft DirectX (SDK October 2006 or later), available from the Microsoft DirectX Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4195.title: PeopleBook component for Mambo param.peoplebook.php file include
CVE-2006-4195.body: The PeopleBook component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the param.peoplebook.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4204.title: PHProjekt path_pre and lib_path file include
CVE-2006-4204.body: PHProjekt could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the lib/specialdays.php script using the 'path_pre' parameter or the lib/dbman_filter.inc.php script using the ''lib_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of PHProjekt (5.1.1 or later) available from the PHProjekt Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4214.title: Zen Cart multiple scripts SQL injection
CVE-2006-4214.body: Zen Cart is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the ipn_get_stored_session, whos_online_session_recreate or add_cart functions using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Zen Cart (1.3.5 or later), available from the Zen Cart Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4215.title: Zen Cart autoLoadConfig[] file include
CVE-2006-4215.body: Zen Cart could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the autoLoadConfig[] variable to specify a malicious file from a remote or local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of Zen Cart (1.3.5 or later), available from the Zen Cart Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4244.title: SQL-Ledger unspecified authentication bypass
CVE-2006-4244.body: SQL-Ledger could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the application, caused by an unspecified vulnerability related to user session handling. An attacker with local network access could exploit this vulnerability to bypass authentication and gain unauthorized access to the application with the privileges of another logged in user.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1239-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information.

CVE-2006-4262.title: Cscope reffile buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4262.body: Cscope is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of command line arguments. By sending an overly long reffile argument, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Apply the latest Cscope CVS patch, available from SourceForge.net. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1186-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4262.title: Cscope cscope.lists buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4262.body: Cscope is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing file lists or expanding environment variables. By sending a specially-crafted cscope.lists file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Apply the latest Cscope CVS patch, available from SourceForge.net. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1186-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4270.title: MambelFish component for Mambo mambelfish.class.php file include
CVE-2006-4270.body: The MambelFish component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the mambelfish.class.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of MambelFish (1.5 or later), available from the MambelFish Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4285.title: Fantastic News news.php file include
CVE-2006-4285.body: Fantastic News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the news.php script using the 'CONFIG[script_path]' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Fantastic News (2.14 or later), available from the Fantastic News Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4288.title: a6MamboCredits component for Mambo admin.a6mambocredits.php file include
CVE-2006-4288.body: a6MamboCredits component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the administrator/components/com_a6mambocredits/admin.a6mambocredits.php script using the mosConfig_live_site parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4299.title: TikiWiki tiki-searchindex.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-4299.body: TikiWiki is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the tiki-searchindex.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'highlight' parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-16 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4301.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer multiple COM object color property denial of service
CVE-2006-4301.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a memory corruption error when a COM object with an overly long color property is instantiated as an ActiveX control. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a victim's browser to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the victim's system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web page.Reportedly, upgrading to Internet Explorer version 7 or higher will remediate this vulnerability.

CVE-2006-4308.title: Blackboard multiple tags cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-4308.body: Blackboard Academic Suite, Blackboard Learning System, and Blackboard Community System are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest patched version of Blackboard Academic Suite (version 7.1.x or later), available from the Blackboard Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4326.title: Justsystem Ichitaro document handling buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4326.body: Justsystem Ichitaro is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. By creating a malformed document with an overly long string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system when the victim opens the file. Note: It has been reported that this vulnerability is being exploited by Trojan.Tarodrop.For Ichitaro 2005/2006:Apply the patch currently available from the Justsystem Web site. See References.For Ichitaro for Linux:Apply the patch as soon as it is available from the Justsystem Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4333.title: Wireshark (Ethereal) SSCOP dissector denial of service
CVE-2006-4333.body: Wireshark (formerly known as Ethereal) is vulnerable to a denial of service. If the SSCOP payload protocol is Q.2931 and the SSCOP dissector is configured with a port range, which is not the default setting, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted packet causing the Q.2931 dissector to consume all available memory resources.Upgrade to the latest version of Wireshark (0.99.3 or later), as listed in Wireshark Security Advisory wnpa-sec-2006-02. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-26 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1171-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0658-14 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4333.title: Wireshark (Ethereal) IPsec ESP preference parser off-by-one
CVE-2006-4333.body: Wireshark (formerly known as Ethereal) is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by multiple off-by-one errors in the IPsec ESP preference parser, if Wireshark was compiled with ESP decryption support. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specially-crafted packet to cause the application to crash and possibly execute arbitrary commands on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Wireshark (0.99.3 or later), as listed in Wireshark Security Advisory wnpa-sec-2006-02. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200608-26 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0658-14 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4339.title: OpenSSL RSA exponent 3 security bypass
CVE-2006-4339.body: OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions caused by an improper validation of certain signatures. If an RSA key with exponent 3 is used, a remote attacker could forge a PKCS #1 v1.5 signature and certificate signed by that key. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized access.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSL (0.9.7j or 0.9.8b or later), as listed in OpenSSL Security Advisory [11 October 2005]. CVE-2006-4340.title: Mozilla Network Security Services RSA signature validation security bypass
CVE-2006-4340.body: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to bypass security, caused by improper verification of RSA signatures by the Network Security Services (NSS) library. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to forge PKCS #1 v1.5 signatures and bypass security restrictions.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-66 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Firefox):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200612-07 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. CVE-2006-4343.title: OpenSSL SSLv2 client get_server_hello() denial of service
CVE-2006-4343.body: OpenSSL is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an error in the SSLv2 client get_server_hello() function. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a victim's OpenSSL client to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to connect to a malicious server.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSL (0.9.7l or 0.9.8d or later), as listed in OpenSSL Security Advisory [28th September 2006]. See References.For HP System Management Homepage:Refer to HPSBMA02250 SSRT061275 rev.1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-4431.title: Zend Platform mod_cluster denial of service
CVE-2006-4431.body: Zend Platform is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a buffer overflow in the mod_cluster module when handling sessions. By sending an overly long or a zero-length session identifier, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the module to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Zend (2.2.1a or later), available from the Zend Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4514.title: libgsf ole_info_read_metabat() OLE file buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4514.body: The GNOME Structured File Library (libgsf) is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the ole_info_read_metabat() function. By creating a specially-crafted OLE file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the permissions of the victim, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the file with an application linked to the vulnerable library.Upgrade to the latest version of libgsf (4.50 or later), available from the freshmeat.net Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1221-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-391-1 for patch, upgrade, or workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0011-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-4517.title: Novell iManager Tomcat server TREE parameter denial of service
CVE-2006-4517.body: The Novell iManager Tomcat server is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a NULL pointer dereference. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP POST request containing an overly long TREE parameter to cause the iManager Tomcat server to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Novell iManager (2.6 or later), available from the Novell iManager Web page. See References.

CVE-2006-4519.title: GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program) image loader plugins code execution
CVE-2006-4519.body: GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in the g_malloc or g_new function of the DICOM, PNM, PSD, PSP, Sun RAS, XBM, and XWD file format plugins. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted file with an overly large length value, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of GIMP (2.2.16 or later), available from the GIMP Web site. See References.For Debian/GNU Linux:Refer to DSA-1335-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (GIMP):Refer to GLSA 200707-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux (gimp):Refer to MDKSA-2007:170 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0513-8 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-4535.title: Linux kernel SCTP SO_LINGER denial of service
CVE-2006-4535.body: The Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by improper handling of SCTP sockets. A local attacker could open an SCTP socket with an invalid SO_LINGER value to cause the kernel to crash.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1183-1 or DSA-1184-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4:Refer to RHSA-2006:0689-15 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-4542.title: Webmin and Usermin source code disclosure
CVE-2006-4542.body: Webmin and Usermin could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to cause the source code of any known CGI or Perl script to be returned.Upgrade to the latest development version of Usermin (1.226 or later) or Webmin (1.296 or later), available from the Webmin Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1199-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4564.title: Simple Machines Forum (SMF) ManageBoards.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-4564.body: Simple Machines Forum (SMF) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker with administrativer access to the application could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the ManageBoards.php script using the cur_cat parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Simple Machines Forum (1.0.9 or later), available from the Simple Machines Forum Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4565.title: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey JavaScript expression buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4565.body: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey are vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of a JavaScript regular expression. By creating a malicious Web page containing specially-crafted JavaScript, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit the malicious page or open a malicious HTML email.Refer to Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2006-57 for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4 (Firefox):Refer to RHSA-2006:0675-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (Seamonkey):Refer to RHSA-2006:0676-10 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 4 (Thunderbird):Refer to RHSA-2006:0677-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200610-01 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux (Seamonkey):Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200610-04 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (Thunderbird):Refer to DSA-1191-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information.
