CVE-2006-4583.title: FlashChat dir[inc] file include
CVE-2006-4583.body: FlashChat could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the aedating4CMS.php, aedatingCMS2.php, or aedatingCMS.php script using the dir[inc] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of FlashChat (4.6.2 or later), available from the FlashChat Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4624.title: GNU Mailman administrative spoofing
CVE-2006-4624.body: GNU Mailman could allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing and phishing attacks against an administrator caused by an error in the logging functionality. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a spoofed log message in the error log using a specially-crafted URL and tricking the administrator into visiting the malicious site.Upgrade to the latest version of GNU Mailman (2.1.9rc1 or later), available from the SourceForge.net Web site. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1188-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Summary Report SUSE-SR:2006:025 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-4637.title: ACGV News PathNews file include
CVE-2006-4637.body: ACGV News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the article.php, header.php, or news.php script using the 'PathNews' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4639.title: C-News path file include
CVE-2006-4639.body: C-News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the formulaire_commentaries.php, liste_news.php, news_complete.php, pagination.php, or commentaries.php script using the 'path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4640.title: Adobe Flash Player allowScriptAccess security bypass
CVE-2006-4640.body: An unspecified vulnerability in Adobe Flash Player (formerly Macromedia Flash Player) could allow a remote attacker to bypass allowScriptAccess protection using unspecified attack vectors.Refer to Adobe Product Security Bulletin APSB06-11 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Apple Mac OS X and Mac OS X Server:Apply Apple Security Update 2006-006 or Mac OS X 10.4.8 Update, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:053 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-4666.title: Stefan E. Newsscript article.php file include
CVE-2006-4666.body: Stefan E. Newsscript could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the article.php script using the ide parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4666.title: WM-News multiple file include
CVE-2006-4666.body: WM-News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the article.php script using the idle parameter or to the delete.php, modify.php, modify_go.php or admin.php script using the pwfile parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4671.title: Fantastic News CONFIG[script_path] file include
CVE-2006-4671.body: Fantastic News could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the archive.php or headlines.php file using the CONFIG[script_path] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Fantastic News (2.1.5 or later), available from the Fantastic News Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4672.title: ppalCart index.php and mainpage.php file include
CVE-2006-4672.body: ppalCart could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the 'proMod' parameter or to the mainpage.php script using the 'docroot' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4687.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer layout combinations code execution
CVE-2006-4687.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, caused by a memory corruption vulnerability in the decoding of HTML layout combinations. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system with the same privileges as the victim, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web page or open a malicious HTML email message.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-4694.title: Microsoft PowerPoint unspecified .ppt file code execution
CVE-2006-4694.body: Microsoft PowerPoint could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system caused by improper handling of malformed presentation files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a victim to open a malicious PowerPoint presentation (.ppt) either by sending the malicious file to a victim as an email attachment or by hosting it on a Web site. Note: It has been reported that this vulnerability is being exploited by the Trojan.Controlppt.W and Trojan.Controlppt.X (also known as PPDropper.F and Exploit-PPT.d).Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-4696.title: Microsoft Windows SMB rename denial of service
CVE-2006-4696.body: Multiple versions of Microsoft Windows are vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a NULL pointer dereference in the server service driver (srv.sys). By sending a specially-crafted SMB rename request to an affected system, a remote attacker with valid authentication credentials could cause the system to reboot.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-4712.title: Sage extension for Mozilla Firefox RSS feeds cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-4712.body: Sage extension for Mozilla Firefox is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the processing of content tags in RSS feeds. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the RSS feed is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Sage (1.3.7 or later), available from the Sage Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4727.title: Tumbleweed Email Firewall statusView.do cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-4727.body: Tumbleweed Email Firewall is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the statusView.do page in the Administration Module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the lineId or sort parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Tumbleweed Email Firewall (6.3.2 or later), available from the Tumbleweed Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4734.body: TikiWiki is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the tiki-g-admin_processes.php script using the pid or where parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-4774.title: Cisco IOS VTP version denial of service
CVE-2006-4774.body: Cisco IOS running on devices with VTP (VLAN Trunking Protocol) Operating Mode set to "client" or "server" are vulnerable to a denial of service attack. A remote attacker on the local network segment could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted packet with the VTP version field value set to 2 to cause the device to reset, resulting in a denial of service.Refer to cisco-sr-20060913-vtp for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4775.title: Cisco IOS VTP wrap configuration manipulation
CVE-2006-4775.body: Cisco IOS and Cisco CatOS could allow a remote attacker to manipulate configuration updates caused by a negative integer wrap issue in the VTP (VLAN Trunking Protocol) feature. If an attacker can send VTP updates to a Cisco IOS or CatOS device, the attacker could revise the VTP revision to 0x7FFFFFFF. When the VLAN configuration is next changed, the revision will be increased to 0x80000000, which would result in the affected device being unable to communicate configuration changes to other devices.Refer to cisco-sr-20060913-vtp for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4776.title: Cisco IOS VTP VLAN name buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4776.body: Cisco IOS is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the VTP (VLAN Trunking Protocol) feature. By sending a VTP summary advertisement containing a VLAN name of more than 100 characters, a remote attacker who can send VTP updated to an affected device could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable device.Refer to cisco-sr-20060913-vtp for upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4777.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer DirectAnimation keyframe buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4777.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the CPathCtl::KeyFrame() function of the DirectAnimation ActiveX control. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on a victim's system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web page.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References.— OR —Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2006-4785.title: Moodle blog/edit.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-4785.body: Moodle is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the blog/edit.php script using the blogEntry parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Moodle (1.62 or later), available fom the Moodle Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4819.title: Opera tag URL buffer overflow
CVE-2006-4819.body: Opera is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of a tag that contains a URL. By creating a Web site containing an overly long URL in a tag, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the browser to crash, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web site.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (9.02 or later), available from the Opera Web site. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:061 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4842.title: Netscape Portable Runtime API file create
CVE-2006-4842.body: Netscape Portable Runtime (NSPR) API could allow a local attacker to create or overwrite arbitrary files on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied environment values. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to create or overwrite arbitrary files on the system with root privileges.For Sun Solaris:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102658 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4844.title: Claroline claro_init_local.inc.php file include
CVE-2006-4844.body: Claroline could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. When register globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the claro_init_local.inc.php script using the extAuthSource[newUser] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: This vulnerability also affected Dokeos, which is based off of the Claroline code base.For Claroline:Upgrade to the latest version of Claroline (1.7.8 or later), available from the Claroline Web site. See References.For Dokeos:No remedy available as of September 2006.

CVE-2006-4855.title: Symantec Norton Personal Firewall Device\SymEvent denial of service
CVE-2006-4855.body: Symantec Norton Personal Firewall is vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by improper handling of data by the \Device\SymEvent library. A local authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using malformed data to cause the system to crash.Refer to the Symantec Web site for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-4858.title: The Serverstat component for Mambo install.serverstat.php file include
CVE-2006-4858.body: The Serverstat component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the install.serverstat.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Serverstat component for Mambo (0.6.2 or later), available from the MamboXchange Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-4924.title: OpenSSH identical block denial of service
CVE-2006-4924.body: OpenSSH is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of identical blocks in an SSH packet. If SSH protocol 1 is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted SSH packet to cause the system to consume all available CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.4.9 or later) or apply Apple Security Update 2007-003. See References.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Red Hat Bugzilla Bug 207955. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200609-17 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2006:0697-9 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux 2.1:Refer to RHSA-2006:0698-8 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (krb5):Refer to DSA-1189-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux (openssh):Refer to DSA-1212-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For HP-UX Secure Shell:Refer to HPSBUX02178 SSRT061267 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE-SA:2006:062 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Solaris (sshd1M):Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102962 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-5031.title: CakePHP js/vendors.php directory traversal
CVE-2006-5031.body: CakePHP could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by an error in the readfile() call. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL request to the js/vendors.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the file parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of CakePHP (1.1.8.3544 or later), available from the CakePHP Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5043.title: JoomlaBoard component for Joomla! file_upload.php and image_upload.php file include
CVE-2006-5043.body: The JoomlaBoard component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the file_upload.php and the image_upload.php script using the sbp parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5045.title: PollXT component for Mambo and Joomla! conf.pollxt.php file include
CVE-2006-5045.body: The PollXT component for Mambo and Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the conf.pollxt.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Apply the patch available from the Mambo Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5048.title: Security Images component for Joomla! multiple scripts file include
CVE-2006-5048.body: The Security Images component for Joomla! could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the client.php, lang.php, server.php, or configinsert.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5080.title: Movable Type search functionality cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5080.body: Movable Type is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the search module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using certain parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Movable Type (3.3 or later), available from the Movable Type Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5093.title: TagIt! Tagboard index.php file include
CVE-2006-5093.body: TagIt! Tagboard could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the page parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5101.title: Multiple Comdev modules path[docroot] file include
CVE-2006-5101.body: Multiple Comdev modules could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the include.php or adminfoot.php script using the path[docroot] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5119.title: Zen Cart login.php and password_forgotten.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5119.body: Zen Cart is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the login.php and password_forgotten.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the Zen Cart Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-5142.title: Computer Associates (CA) BrightStor Discovery service Mailslot buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5142.body: The Discovery service in Computer Associates BrightStor ARCserve Backup is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of messages received over the "CheyenneDS" Mailslot. By sending an overly long message, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Refer to the CA SupportConnect Security Notice for BrightStor ARCserve Backup for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-5143.title: Computer Associates (CA) RPC Server DBASVR.exe buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5143.body: Multiple Computer Associates server backup products are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking within the Backup Agent RPC Server (DBASVR.exe). By sending a specially-crafted RPC request to TCP port 6071, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM privileges.Refer to the CA SupportConnect Security Notice for BrightStor ARCserve Backup for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2006-5149.title: OpenBiblio shared/header.php and shared/help.php file include
CVE-2006-5149.body: OpenBiblio could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the shared/header.php and shared/help.php scripts using the page and tab parameters to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenBiblio (0.6.0 or later), available from the OpenBiblio Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5168.title: Pebble search functionality cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5168.body: Pebble is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input in the search module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Pebble ( Pebble 2.0.0-RC2 or later), available from the Pebble Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5175.title: TeraStation administration interface cross-site request forgery
CVE-2006-5175.body: TeraStation HD-HTGL Series is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by an error in the Web administration interface. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to delete data or modify certain configuration settings.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5176.title: MailEnable NTLM message buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5176.body: MailEnable is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of NTLM type 1 messages. By sending a specially-crafted NTLM type 1 message, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system, if NTLM authentication is enabled.Apply Hotfix ME-10015, available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5177.title: MailEnable base64 message code execution
CVE-2006-5177.body: MailEnable could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted base64 Type3 message to cause an out of bounds read error allowing the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, if NTLM authentication is enabled.Apply Hotfix ME-10015, available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5177.title: MailEnable base64 NTLM message denial of service
CVE-2006-5177.body: MailEnable is vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by an out of bounds error when processing base64 encoded NTLM Type1 messages. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted base64 encoded NTLM Type1 message to cause a denial of service, if NTLM authentication is enabled.Apply Hotfix ME-10015, available from the MailEnable Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5191.title: phpBB Static Topics functions_static_topics.php file include
CVE-2006-5191.body: phpBB Static Topics could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the functions_static_topics.php script using the phpbb_root_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5220.title: WebYep webyep_sIncludePath parameter file include
CVE-2006-5220.body: WebYep could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the webyep_sIncludePath parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: /lib/WYApplication.php /lib/WYDocument.php /lib/WYEditor.php /lib/WYElement.php /lib/WYFile.php /lib/WYHTMLTag.php /lib/WYImage.php /lib/WYLanguage.php /lib/WYLink.php /lib/WYPath.php /lib/WYPopupWindowLink.php /lib/WYSelectMenu.php /lib/WYTextArea.php /elements/WYGalleryElement.php /elements/WYGuestbookElement.php /elements/WYImageElement.php /elements/WYLogonButtonElement.php /elements/WYLongTextElement.php /elements/WYLoopElement.php /elements/WYMenuElement.php /elements/WYShortTextElement.php /programm/webyep.phpUpgrade to the latest version of WebYep (1.1.10 or later), available from the WebYep Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5221.title: Cahier de Texte lire.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-5221.body: Cahier de Texte is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the lire.php script using the "classe_ID" or "matiere_ID" parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5239.title: eXpBlog kalender.php and pre_details.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5239.body: eXpBlog is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the kalender.php and pre_details.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using $_SERVER[PHP-SELF] or $_POST[captcha_session_code] parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of eXpBlog when it is available from the eXpBlog.de Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5265.title: Microsoft Dynamics GP magic number denial of service
CVE-2006-5265.body: Microsoft Dynamics GP (formerly known as Great Plains) is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of Distributed Process Server (DPS) messages. By sending a specially-crafted DPS message containing an invalid magic number, a remote attacker could cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Microsoft Dynamics GP (10.0 or later), available from the Microsoft Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5266.title: Microsoft Dynamics GP DPM multiple buffer overflows
CVE-2006-5266.body: Microsoft Dynamics GP (formerly known as Great Plains) is vulnerable to multiple stack and heap-based buffer overflows in the Distributed Process Manager (DPM) component. By sending a specially-crafted DPM message, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Microsoft Dynamics GP (10.0 or later), available from the Microsoft Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5266.title: Microsoft Dynamics GP DPS and DPM IP address buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5266.body: Microsoft Dynamics GP (formerly known as Great Plains) is vulnerable to multiple stack and heap-based buffer overflows in the Distributed Process Server (DPS) and Distributed Process Manager (DPM) components. By sending a specially-crafted DPS message containing an overly long IP address, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Microsoft Dynamics GP (9.0 SP3 or 10.0 or later), available from the Microsoft Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5266.title: Microsoft Dynamics GP DPS and DPM string buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5266.body: Microsoft Dynamics GP (formerly known as Great Plains) is vulnerable to multiple stack and heap-based buffer overflows in the Distributed Process Server (DPS) and Distributed Process Manager (DPM) components. By sending a specially-crafted DPS message containing an overly long string, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Microsoft Dynamics GP (10.0 or later), available from the Microsoft Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5268.title: Trend Micro ServerProtect unauthorized administrative access
CVE-2006-5268.body: Trend Micro ServerProtect could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized administrative access to the RPC interface. A remote attacker could bypass authentication and gain administrative access, allowing the attacker to execute code with SYSTEM privileges.For Trend Micro ServerProtect for Windows 5.58:Apply the patch for this vulnerability (Patch 7, build 1216), available from the Trend Micro Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5269.title: Trend Micro ServerProtect heap buffer overflow 1
CVE-2006-5269.body: Trend Micro ServerProtect is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM privileges.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5291.title: Download-Engine spaw_root file include
CVE-2006-5291.body: Download-Engine could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the spaw_root, spaw_dir, spaw_base_url or the _ENGINE[eng_dir] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Download-Engine (1.4.3 or later), available from the ScriptEngine.de Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5301.title: SpamBlocker module for phpBB antispam.php file include
CVE-2006-5301.body: SpamBlocker module for phpBB could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the antispam.php script using the phpbb_root_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5302.title: Redaction System lang_prefix parameter file include
CVE-2006-5302.body: Redaction System could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the conn.php, sesscheck.php, wap/conn.php, or wap/sesscheck.php script using the lang_prefix parameter or to the index.php script using the lang parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Redaction System (1.0001 or later), available from the Jan Krupa Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5310.title: phpMyConferences menus.php file include
CVE-2006-5310.body: phpMyConferences could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the menus.php or the init.php script using the lvc_include_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5313.title: Hastymail IMAP and SMTP server command execution
CVE-2006-5313.body: Hastymail could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system. A remote authenticated attacker could send a specially-crafted request using the mailbox or subject parameter containing an end of command sequence to the IMAP or SMTP server, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server.For Hastymail 1.0.2:Refer to Security Update 10-08-2006, available from the Hastymail Web page. See References.For Hastymail 1.5:Refer to Security Update 10-08-2006, available from the Hastymail Web page. See References.

CVE-2006-5390.title: phpBB ACP User Registration functions_mod_user.php file include
CVE-2006-5390.body: phpBB ACP User Registration could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the functions_mod_user.php script using the phpbb_root_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of phpBB ACP User Registration (1.01 or later), available from the phpBB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5399.title: PHPRecipeBook Import_MM.class.php file include
CVE-2006-5399.body: PHPRecipeBook could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the Import_MM.class.php script using the g_rb_basedir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of PHPRecipeBook (2.37 or later), available from the PHPRecipeBook Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5402.title: PhpMyBibli include_path parameter file include
CVE-2006-5402.body: PhpMyBibli could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the cart.php, edit.php, circ.php, index.php, or select.php script using the include_path, javascript_path, or class_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of PhpMyBibli (2.2 or later), available from the PMB Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5418.title: phpBB SearchIndexer Mod archive_topic.php file include
CVE-2006-5418.body: phpBB SearchIndexer Mod could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the archive_topic.php script using the phpbb_root_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5424.title: Justsystem Ichitaro unspecified buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5424.body: Justsystem Ichitaro is vulnerable to an unspecified buffer overflow. By creating a specially-crafted document, a remote attacker could execute arbitrary code on the system, if the attacker could persuade the victim to open the document.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Justsystem Web site. See References

CVE-2006-5439.title: Multiple Comdev modules path[docroot] file include
CVE-2006-5439.body: Multiple Comdev modules could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the include.php or adminfoot.php script using the path[docroot] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5451.title: TorrentFlux startpop.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5451.body: TorrentFlux is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the startpop.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the torrent parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of TorrentFlux (2.2 or later), available from the TorrentFlux Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5456.title: ImageMagick and GraphicsMagick ReadPALMImage function buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5456.body: ImageMagick and GraphicsMagick are vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the ReadPALMImage function in the coders/palm.c file. By processing a specially-crafted PALM image, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2006:066 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1213-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux: Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200611-19 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0015-5 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-422-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5486.title: Sun Java System and iPlanet Messaging Servers Webmail module cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5486.body: Sun Java System and iPlanet Messaging Servers are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by an unspecified error in the Webmail module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying malicious Javascript in an email message that would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the message is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.For SPARC, x86 and Linux Platforms:Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102497 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-5507.title: Der Dirigent cfg_dedi[dedi_path] parameter file include
CVE-2006-5507.body: Der Dirigent could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the cfg_dedi[dedi_path] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: backend/external/wysiswg/popups/find.php backend/external/wysiswg/popups/insert_line.php, backend/external/wysiswg/popups/fullscreen.php, backend/external/wysiswg/popups/changecase.php, backend/external/wysiswg/popups/insert_link.php, backend/external/wysiswg/popups/insert_table.php, backend/external/wysiswg/popups/table_cellprop.php, backend/external/wysiswg/popups/table_prop.php, and backend/external/wysiswg/popups/table_rowprop.phpNo remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5517.title: Open Meetings Filing Application PROJECT_ROOT file include
CVE-2006-5517.body: Open Meetings Filing Application could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the editmeetings/session.php, email/session.php, entityproperties/session.php, or inc/mail.php script using the PROJECT_ROOT parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5519.title: MambWeather module for Mambo Savant2_Plugin_options.php file include
CVE-2006-5519.body: MambWeather module for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the Savant2_plugin_options.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5552.title: RevilloC MailServer RCPT TO: and MAIL FOR: buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5552.body: RevilloC MailServer is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of user-supplied input passed to various commands, including the RCPT TO: and MAIL FOR: commands. By sending an overly long RCPT TO: or MAIL FOR: command, a remote attacker could consume all available CPU resources or overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5559.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer ADODB.Connection code execution
CVE-2006-5559.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service, caused by an unspecified vulnerability in the ADODB.Connection ActiveX control. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page, and persuading a victim to visit the page.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS07-009. See References.

CVE-2006-5568.title: FtpXQ Server MKD denial of service
CVE-2006-5568.body: FtpXQ Server is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of the MKD command. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending an overly long MKD command to consume all available CPU resources.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5601.title: Open 1x Xsupplicant eap_do_notify() function buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5601.body: Open 1x Xsupplicant is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the eap_do_notify() function. By sending a specially-crafted EAP packet, a remote authenticated attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of Xsupplicant (1.2.8 or later), available from the SourceForge.net Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5606.title: BytesFall Explorer (bfExplorer) dologin.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-5606.body: BytesFall Explorer (bfExplorer) is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes is disabled, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login/dologin.php script using the username field parameter, which could allow the attacker to bypass authentication or view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of BytesFall Explorer (0.0.72 or later), available from the BytesFall Explorer Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5612.title: GestArt aide.php3 file include
CVE-2006-5612.body: GestArt could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the aide.php3 script using the aide parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5619.title: Linux kernel seqfile IPv6 flowlabel denial of service
CVE-2006-5619.body: Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by a vulnerability in the seqfile handling for proc/net/ip6_flowlabel code. A local attacker could send a specially-crafted flow label to cause an infinite loop condition that will lock up the kernel and crash the system, resulting in a denial of service.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from The Linux Kernel Archives. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200610-08 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Linux Security Advisory MDKSA-2007:012 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (kernel):Refer to RHSA-2007:0014 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5621.title: ask_rave end.php file include
CVE-2006-5621.body: ask_rave could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the end.php script using the footfile parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of ask_rave (version 0.9b or later), available from the Rave.jk-digital.com Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5629.title: Hosting Controller multiple SQL injection
CVE-2006-5629.body: Hosting Controller is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the email field or login field, or to the accountmanager.asp, GatewayVariables.asp, or DisableForum.asp script using the sortfield, GateWayID, or ForumID parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (Post-Hotfix 3.3 Security Patch), available from the Hosting Controller Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5634.title: phpProfiles multiple scripts file include
CVE-2006-5634.body: phpProfiles could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the body.inc.php or the body_blog.inc.php script using the reqpath parameter or the upload_ht.inc.php script using the usrinc parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of phpProfiles (3.7 or later), available from the phpProfiles Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5702.title: TikiWiki multiple .php scripts password information disclosure
CVE-2006-5702.body: TikiWiki could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a vulnerability in multiple scripts using the sort_mode parameter. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the user password, which could be used to launch further attacks on the system. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: tiki-listpages.php?offset=0&sort_mode= /tiki-lastchanges.php?days=1&offset=0&sort_mode= /messu-archive.php?sort_mode= /messu-mailbox.php?sort_mode= /messu-sent.php?sort_mode= /tiki-directory_add_site.php?sort_mode= /tiki-directory_ranking.php?sort_mode= /tiki-directory_search.php?sort_mode= /tiki-forums.php?sort_mode= /tiki-view_forum.php?forumId= /tiki-friends.php?sort_mode= /tiki-list_blogs.php?sort_mode= /tiki-list_faqs.php?sort_mode= /tiki-list_trackers.php?sort_mode= /tiki-list_users.php?sort_mode= /tiki-my_tiki.php?sort_mode= /tiki-notepad_list.php?sort_mode= /tiki-orphan_pages.php?sort_mode= /tiki-shoutbox.php?sort_mode= /tiki-usermenu.php?sort_mode= /tiki-webmail_contacts.php?sort_mode=Upgrade to the latest version of Tikiwiki (1.9.6 or later), available from the Tikiwiki Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5710.title: Apple AirPort driver probe response code execution
CVE-2006-5710.body: The Apple AirPort driver used with Orinoco-based 802.11 wireless cards could allow a remote attacker within wireless range to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of probe response frames containing invalid information element (IE) fields. If the driver is in active scanning mode, an attacker could send a specially-crafted probe response to corrupt kernel memory and execute arbitrary code on the targeted system.Apply Apple Security Update 2006-007, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5725.title: AEP SmartGate header information disclosure
CVE-2006-5725.body: AEP SmartGate could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could view a HTTP header response to determine the location of specific directories on the system. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.Upgrade to the latest version of AEP SmartGate (4.3C or later), available from the AEP Networks Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5728.title: XM Easy Personal FTP Server NLST command denial of service
CVE-2006-5728.body: XM Easy Personal FTP Server is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of a malformed NLST command. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted NLST command to cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5757.title: Linux kernel ISO9660 denial of service
CVE-2006-5757.body: The Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by improper handling of corrupted data structures by the isofs_get_blocks() function when mounting a corrupted filesystem. By performing a read on a specially-crafted ISO9660 filesystem, a local attacker can cause an infinite loop in the isofs_get_blocks() function, resulting in a denial of service.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Linux Security Advisory MDKSA-2007:012 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux (kernel):Refer to RHSA-2007:0014 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-416-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5758.title: Microsoft Windows GDI kernel privilege escalation
CVE-2006-5758.body: Microsoft Windows 2000 and XP could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by improper handling of GDI kernel structures. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS07-017. See References.

CVE-2006-5762.title: Free Image Hosting AD_BODY_TEMP parameter file include
CVE-2006-5762.body: Free Image Hosting could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the login.php, frontpage.php, or forgot_pass.php script using the AD_BODY_TEMP parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5762.title: Free File Hosting AD_BODY_TEMP file include
CVE-2006-5762.body: Free File Hosting could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the forgot_pass.php, contact.php, login.php, register.php or send.php script using the AD_BODY_TEMP parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5764.title: Free File Hosting AD_BODY_TEMP file include
CVE-2006-5764.body: Free File Hosting could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the forgot_pass.php, contact.php, login.php, register.php or send.php script using the AD_BODY_TEMP parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5767.title: Drake CMS xhtml.php file include
CVE-2006-5767.body: Drake CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the xhtml.php script using the d_root parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Drake CMS (0.2.3 r916 or later), available from the Drake CMS Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5779.title: OpenLDAP BIND denial of service
CVE-2006-5779.body: OpenLDAP is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an error when processing BIND requests. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted BIND request to cause the server to crash.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Linux Security Advisory MDKSA-2006:208 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-384-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200611-25 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5789.title: WarFTPD string denial of service
CVE-2006-5789.body: WarFTPD is vulnerable to denial of service attack, caused by a buffer overflow. By sending an overly long string containing a large number of %s characters, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and cause the server to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of War FTP Daemon (1.82.0 RC13 or later), available from the War FTP Daemon Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5793.title: libpng png_set_sPLT function denial of service
CVE-2006-5793.body: libpng is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an out-of-bounds read in the png_set_sPLT function in pngset.c. By sending a specially-crafted PNG file, a remote attacker could crash applications linked to the vulnerable library.For Gentoo:Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in Gentoo Bugzilla Bug 154380. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Linux Security Advisory MDKSA-2006:210 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Linux Security Advisory MDKSA-2006:209 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200611-09 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-383-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0356 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Turbolinux (libpng):Refer to TLSA-2007-45 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mac OS X:Apply Security Update 2008-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5815.title: ProFTPD sreplace() buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5815.body: ProFTPD is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the sreplace function. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the server to crash.Upgrade to the latest patched version of ProFTPD (version 1.3.0a or later), available from the ProFTPD Web site. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to GLSA 200611-26 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Debian Linux:Refer to DSA-1222-2 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5829.title: AIOCP (All In One Control Panel) choosed_language SQL injection
CVE-2006-5829.body: AIOCP (All In One Control Panel) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to multiple scripts using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: /public/code/cp_dpage.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_news.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_news.php?news_category /public/code/cp_forum_view.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_edit_user.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_newsletter.php?nlmsg_nlcatid /public/code/cp_newsletter.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_links.php?links_category /public/code/cp_links.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_contact_us.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_show_ec_products.php?product_category_id /public/code/cp_show_ec_products.php?product_category_id /public/code/cp_show_ec_products.php?order_field /public/code/cp_login.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_users_online.php?order_field /public/code/cp_codice_fiscale.php?choosed_language /public/code/cp_links_search.php?orderdirNo remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5840.title: abarcar Realty Portal newsdetail.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-5840.body: abarcar Realty Portal is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the newsdetail.php script using the neid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. Note: The newsdetail.php script is no longer in existence in abarcar Realty Portal (version7.2 or later).Upgrade to the latest version of abarcar Realty Portal (7.2 or later). Contact abarcar Software for information on obtaining an upgrade. See References.

CVE-2006-5843.title: Speedywiki index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5843.body: Speedywiki is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the showRevisions parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Speedywiki (version 2.2 or later), available from the Speedwiki Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5846.title: FreeWebshop page directory traversal
CVE-2006-5846.body: FreeWebshop could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the page parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of FreeWebshop (2.2.2 or later), available from the FreeWebshop Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5858.title: Adobe ColdFusion MX URL parsing information disclosure
CVE-2006-5858.body: Adobe ColdFusion MX could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper URL parsing. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL with a double-encoded null byte to obtain directory listings, which could be used to launch further attacks against the affected system. Note: This ColdFusion vulnerability only exists when it is running on Microsoft IIS.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, as listed in Adobe Security bulletin APSB07-02. See References.

CVE-2006-5860.title: Adobe Macromedia JRun administrator console cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-5860.body: Adobe JRun is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the administrator console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL to the administrative console to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials. NOTE: ColdFusion MX 7.0 Enterprise Edition is vulnerable to this exploit if installed as the "Multi-Server" option. ColdFusion MX 6.1 Enterprise is vulnerable to this exploit if installed on JRun 4.0 with the "J2EE" option.Refer to APSB07-05 for patch or update information. See References.

CVE-2006-5865.title: MyAlbum language.inc.php file include
CVE-2006-5865.body: MyAlbum could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the language.inc.php script using the langs_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5870.title: OpenOffice.org and StarOffice/Office Suite WMF and EMF buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5870.body: OpenOffice.org and StarOffice/Office Suite are vulnerable to multiple heap-based buffer overflows, caused by improper bounds checking of META_ESCAPE, EMR_POLYPOLYGON, and EMR_POLYPOLYGON16 records in WMF and EMF files. By creating a specially-crafted WMF or EMF file and persuading a victim to open the file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to OpenOffice.org Issue 70042 for patch information. See References.For Red Hat Linux:Refer to RHSA-2007:0001-3 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For SUSE Linux:Refer to SUSE Security Announcement SUSE-SA:2007:001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For StarOffice and StarSuite::Refer to Sun Alert ID: 102735 for patch or upgrade information. See References.For Debian GNU/Linux:Refer to DSA-1246-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Ubuntu Linux:Refer to USN-406-1 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Gentoo Linux:Refer to Gentoo Linux Security Announcement GLSA 200701-07 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For Mandriva Linux:Refer to Mandriva Linux Security Advisory MDKSA-2007:006 for patch, upgrade, or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5882.title: Broadcom BCMWL5.SYS buffer overflow
CVE-2006-5882.body: The Broadcom BCMWL5.SYS wireless device driver is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper handling of 802.11 probe responses. By sending a request containing an overly long SSID field, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.For Linksys:Upgrade to the latest driver version (4.100.15.5 or later), available from the Linksys WPC300N Web site. See References.For Zonet:Upgrade to the latest driver version available from the Zonet Web site. See References.For other distributions:Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2006-5897.title: PhpMyChat Plus ChatPath multiple .php scripts source code disclosure
CVE-2006-5897.body: PhpMyChat Plus could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the ChatPath or the L parameter to cause the scripts' source code to be returned. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: avatar.php colorhelp_popup.php color_popup.php index.php index1.php /lib/connected_users.lib.php /lib/index.lib.php logs.php phpMyChat.php3No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5909.title: SCARF generaloptions.php privilege escalation
CVE-2006-5909.body: Stanford Conference And Research Forum (SCARF) could allow a remote attacker with a valid user account to gain administrative privileges on the forum caused by improper security checks by the generaloptions.php script. A remote attacker could access the general options menu and obtain administrative privileges to the application.Upgrade to the latest version of Stanford Conference And Research Forum (2007-02-27 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2006-5938.title: AVG Anti-Virus CAB denial of service
CVE-2006-5938.body: AVG Anti-Virus is vulnerable to adenial of service attack, caused by an uninitialized variable vulnerability in the parsing of CAB archives. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of AVG Anti-Virus (7.1.407 or later), available from the GRISOFT AVG Anti-Virus Software Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5966.title: Panda ActiveScan PAVPZ.SOS.1 ActiveX control information disclosure
CVE-2006-5966.body: The Panda ActiveScan ActiveX control (PAVPZ.SOS.1) could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information caused by a vulnerability in the ObtenerTamano method. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web site.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Panda ActiveScan Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-5966.title: Panda ActiveScan Activescan.1 ActiveX control denial of service
CVE-2006-5966.body: The Panda ActiveScan ActiveX control (ActiveScan.1) is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a vulnerability in the Reinicializar method. CVE-2006-5981.title: Selenium Server directory traversal
CVE-2006-5981.body: Selenium Server could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by a vulnerability in the processing of arguments passed to the DIR, GET or PUT commands. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-6037.title: Travelsized CMS index.php cross-site scripting

CVE-2006-6095.body: Active News Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the rsgallery2.html.php script using the 'mosConfig_absolute_path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.
