CVE-2006-6976.body: CentiPaid could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the centipaid_class.php script using the absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-6977.title: FreeTextBox and FCKEditor Javascript cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-6977.body: FreeTextBox and FCKEditor are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using specially-crafted Javascript code to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-6978.title: FreeTextBox and FCKEditor Javascript cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-6978.body: FreeTextBox and FCKEditor are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using specially-crafted Javascript code to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7021.title: Plume CMS dbinstall.php file include
CVE-2006-7021.body: Plume CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the dbinstall.php script using the '_PX_config[manager_path]' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7025.title: Bookmark4U admin/config.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-7025.body: Bookmark4U could allow a remote attacker to gain administrative access using SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the admin/config.php script using the 'sqlcmd' or 'mode' parameters, which could allow the attacker to gain administrative access to the system and possibly add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7047.title: ShoutPro include.php file include
CVE-2006-7047.body: ShoutPro could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the include.php script using the 'path' parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system. Note: The details of this vulnerability have been disputed. It is unclear whether this vulnerability can be used to execute arbitrary code.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7059.title: E-Dating System cindex.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-7059.body: E-Dating System is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the cindex.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the 'id' parameter or the 'message box' and 'profile input boxes' to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7070.title: Etomite CMS rfiles.php file upload
CVE-2006-7070.body: Etomite CMS could allow a remote attacker with valid authentication credentials to upload malicious files to the system. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP POST request to the rfiles.php script to specify and upload a malicious image file. After uploading the file, the attacker could change the file extension to .PHP and possibly execute arbitrary PHP code on the vulnerable system.Refer to the Etomite Web site for patch information. See References.

CVE-2006-7086.title: Hot Links dlback.php information disclosure
CVE-2006-7086.body: Hot Links could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The database backup file is stored in the server insecurely. A remote attacker could send a URL request to the dlback.php script to obtain a full copy of the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7089.title: Ban connexion.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-7089.body: Ban is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the connexion.php script using the $id variable, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7090.title: phpBB Security php_security.php file include
CVE-2006-7090.body: phpBB Security could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the phpbb_security.php script using the php_root_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7098.title: Debian Apache tty privilege escalation
CVE-2006-7098.body: Debian Linux could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges caused by an error in the Apache server. The Apache server does not release the controlling tty. If the Apache server is manually started and the root shell is not closed, a local attacker could send a specially-crafted CGI script to gain root privileges on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Debian Apache, available to users from the Debian Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-7102.title: phpBurningPortal lang_path file include
CVE-2006-7102.body: phpBurningPortal could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the quest_delete.php, quest_edit.php, or quest_news.php script using the lang_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7104.title: MOStlyCEV component for Mambo htmltemplate.php file include
CVE-2006-7104.body: The MOStlyCEV component for Mambo could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the htmltemplate.php script using the mosConfig_absolute_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7105.title: Smarty Smarty.class.php file include
CVE-2006-7105.body: Smarty could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the Smarty.class.php script using the filename parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7106.title: Power Phlogger config.inc.php file include
CVE-2006-7106.body: Power Phlogger could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the config.inc.php3 script using the rel_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7112.title: MD-Pro PNSVlang file include
CVE-2006-7112.body: MD-Pro could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the error.php script using the PNSVlang cookie parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7114.title: P-News db/user.txt information disclosure
CVE-2006-7114.body: P-News could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a direct request to the db/user.txt file which could allow the attacker to view valid usernames and password information. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7117.title: Kubix header.php file include
CVE-2006-7117.body: Kubix could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the header.php script using the theme parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7118.title: Engine Manager index.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-7118.body: DMXReady Site Engine Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.asp script using the mid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to the DMXReady Support Forum posting dated 17 Jan 2009 12:51 PM for upgrade and suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2006-7127.title: JAF CMS main_dir file include
CVE-2006-7127.body: JAF CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the main.php or the headlines.php script using the main_dir parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7130.title: Jinzora media.php file include
CVE-2006-7130.body: Jinzora could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the media.php script using the include_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7139.title: KDE KMail table and frameset tags denial of service
CVE-2006-7139.body: KDE KMail is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper parsing of HTML tags. If HTML is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTML email using a combination of the "table" and "frameset" tags which could cause KMail to crash, once the message is viewed.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-7147.title: phpBB Import Tools Mod functions_mod_user.php file include
CVE-2006-7147.body: phpBB Import Tools Mod could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the functions_mod_user.php script using the phpbb_root_path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7157.title: Google Earth kml and kmz buffer overflow
CVE-2006-7157.body: Google Earth is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of kml and kmz files. By sending an overly long kml or kmz file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash, if the attacker could convince the victim to load the malicious file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7160.title: Outpost Firewall Pro multiple hooked functions denial of service
CVE-2006-7160.body: Outpost Firewall Pro is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by a vulnerability in the Sandbox.sys Outpost driver when handling the parameters of multiple hooked functions. A local attacker could call the NtAssignProcessToJobObject(), NtCreateKey(), NtCreateThread(), NtDeleteFile(), NtLoadDriver(), NtOpenProcess(), NtProtectVirtualMemory(), NtReplaceKey(), NtTerminateProcess(), NtTerminateThread(), NtUnloadDriver(), or the NtWriteVirtualMemory() using specially-crafted parameters to cause the system to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Outpost Firewall Pro ( 4.0 1005.590.123 or later), available from the Outpost Firewall Pro Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-7170.title: mega-mall product_review.php SQL injection
CVE-2006-7170.body: mega-mall is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the product_review.php or order-track.php script using the t, productId, or orderNo parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify, or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7171.title: mega-mall product_review.php path disclosure
CVE-2006-7171.body: mega-mall could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the product_review.php script using an invalid productId parameter to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7222.title: Media Player Classic .FLI files buffer overflow
CVE-2006-7222.body: Media Player Classic is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when handling .FLI files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .FLI file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7231.title: Civica display.asp SQL injection
CVE-2006-7231.body: Civica is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the display.asp script using the Entry parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2006-7233.title: Openfire login.jsp cross-site scripting
CVE-2006-7233.body: Openfire is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the login.jsp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the url parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Openfire (3.6.0 or later), available from the Ignite Realtime Web site. See References.

CVE-2006-7235.title: Universal FTP multiple commands denial of service
CVE-2006-7235.body: Universal FTP is vulnerable to a denial of service attack, caused by improper validation when processing arguments. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted STOR, PUT or MKD command to crash the FTP service with a runtime error, resulting in a denial of service.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-7237.title: Ixprim CMS Theme_Manager.class.php file include
CVE-2006-7237.body: Ixprim CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the Theme_Manager.class.php script to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2006-5506.title: Wiclear path file include
CVE-2006-5506.body: Wiclear could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to multiple scripts using the path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: The following scripts are reported to be vulnerable: prepend.inc.php boxes.lib.php tools.lib.php index.php history.lib.phpUpgrade to the latest version of Wiclear (0.10.1 or later), available from the Wiclear Web site. See References.
